description:
Abteilung Information

Winkler+Dünnebier GmbH (W+D) hat sich seit der Gründung 1913 als im Maschinenbau weltweit führender Technologie- und Servicepartner für die Mail- und Hygieneindustrie etabliert. Das Unternehmen entwickelt hoch effiziente Systemlösungen zur Produktion, Bedruckung und Kuvertierung von Briefumschlägen sowie zur Herstellung von Hygieneprodukten. W+D ist Teil des Barry-Wehmiller Konzerns und dort in der BW Converting Solutions Plattform verankert. Unsere Mitarbeiter tragen mit ihrer meist langjährigen Erfahrung und ihrem großen Engagement wesentlich zu dem ausgezeichneten Ruf unserer Maschinen und dem hervorragenden Service von W+D bei. Neben unseren Standorten in Deutschland arbeiten wir eng mit unseren Dependancen in den USA und Malaysia zusammen. Wichtig ist uns dabei ein kollegiales, international geprägtes Betriebsklima.

Barry-Wehmiller ist ein breitgefächerter globaler Anbieter von Lösungen für Engineering, Beratung und Fertigungstechnologien für Verpackungs-, Wellpappen- und Papierverarbeitungsindustrien. Die Kombination eines mitarbeiterorientierten Führungsstils mit operativen Strategien und nachhaltigem Wachstum ließ Barry-Wehmiller zu einem 3 Milliarden USD Unternehmen wachsen, dessen fast 12.000 Mitarbeiter eine gemeinsame Vision haben: Building a Better World through Business.

Jobbeschreibung
Durchführen von Fehlerdiagnosen an Antriebs- und Automatisierungssystemen
Feststellen von Fehlfunktionen und deren Ursache, Einleitung von geeigneten Maßnahmen zur Abstellung der Fehlerursachen
Durchführung der Servicearbeiten mittels Telefons, E-Mail und Fernwartung zum kurzfristigen Support internationaler Kunden
Durchführen von Inbetriebnahmen in unserer Produktion
Projektbezogene Montagen vor Ort (ca. 30% jährlich)
Anforderungen
Wir erwarten eine abgeschlossene Technikerausbildung bzw. eine Weiterbildung zum staatlich geprüften Techniker (m/w/d) Fachrichtung Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation als Facharbeiter mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Antriebs- und Automatisierungstechnik
Kenntnisse in der Programmierung von Antriebs- und SPS-Steuerungen (vorzugsweise Siemens oder Bosch Rexroth)
gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Teamfähigkeit
Kreativität und Freude an der Entwicklung innovativer Lösungen
Kundenorientierung
Zielführende Arbeitsweise und Qualitätsbewusstsein
Bei Barry-Wehmiller sind wir uns bewusst, dass Menschen eine Fülle von Erfahrungen und Talenten mitbringen, die über die technischen Anforderungen einer Stelle hinausgehen. Wenn Ihre Erfahrung dem, was Sie hier aufgelistet sehen, nur nahekommt, ziehen Sie bitte trotzdem eine Bewerbung in Betracht. Wir wissen, dass das, was uns voneinander unterscheidet, oft zu Innovation, Spitzenleistungen und sinnvoller Arbeit führen kann - daher ermutigen wir Menschen mit unterschiedlichem Hintergrund, sich auf unsere Stellen zu bewerben. Bitte lassen Sie uns wissen, wenn wir für Sie während des Interview Prozesses angemessene Vorkehrungen treffen können.

Company

Winkler+Dunnebier

Are you looking for a hybrid or remote work opportunity? Are you interested in a workplace that allows for flexibility in your day? Are you ready for a workplace that provides benefits that suit your needs?

As a Senior Software Engineer , your primary mission will be to design, write, test, deploy, and support new and existing Relativity software products, in a brand new, startup-style Relativity office in Krakow, Poland.  We’re looking for someone who has an interest in developing next-generation technologies and passion for getting things done. Is experienced and leverages that to solve complex problems. Enjoys working with smart people and having fun building something great. The perfect team member is also versatile, displays leadership qualities and is enthusiastic about tackling new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. Enjoys taking responsibility in a self-managing team and understands and supports principles of Agile, like iterative approach, ability to cope with the constant change, feedback culture where everything is assessed quickly and changed to fit.   If you have the desire to be continually challenged and work where boredom is an anomaly, then join our Krakow team and be part of a successful Agile-oriented company, experiencing rapid growth in the eDiscovery field, that is currently building its new R&D office in Poland!

The Enrichment Team

Relativity’s “Enrichment” product is the fastest way to feed terabytes of complex and abstract data into the Relativity’s Review platform. As part of the Enrichment team, you will work on modernizing the Enrichment user experience, deal with the unique challenge of processing a diverse set of documents, a tremendous amount of data and do complicated data extraction at blazing speeds. If an opportunity to deal with big-data, solve complex scalability challenges, and learn a distinct set of technologies on a secure SaaS platform excites you, then this is the right team for you.

Your Role in Action

Contributing to a Scrum team that solves complex challenges and builds working software.
Producing high quality code in an effective manner.
Being a dependable and highly skilled team member that is a role model for others and a source of knowledge and inspirations for them.
Troubleshooting issues by fixing defects and responding to client specific problems.
Working on a scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering technologies and client component interaction through web services.
Building highly distributable eDiscovery system composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers, that have potential to be used in other industries that require heavy processing on big, unstructured document sets.

Senior Software Engineer performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of their position:

Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.
Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications and standards.
Improves operations by conducting systems analysis; recommends changes in policies and procedures.
Encourages pair programming to communicate design knowledge throughout the Scrum team.
Provides development expertise to team members through education and review.
Is always open to new ideas and encourages innovative practices amongst peers.
Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection You may be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved.

Your Skills

5+ years of experience in software development of commercial-grade systems and applications
Experience in .NET software development using C# and Microsoft SQL Server, experience in .NET core will be a plus
Experience with CI/CD process and tools (BitBucket, Jenkins, Git) including unit testing, preferably TDD approach.
Good understanding of Cloud Native Patterns and Azure cloud will be a plus.
Fluency in English.
Knowledge and experience in working with Agile frameworks.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Benefit Highlights

Comprehensive health plan

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Long-term incentive program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Über 2.700 Mitarbeiter weltweit, börsennotiert und globaler Marktführer für “digitales Bauen”: RIB Software GmbH, Teil der Schneider Electric GmbH, gehört zu den größten Technologieunternehmen des Landes und revolutionierte mit der cloudbasierten End-to-End-Lösung “iTWO 5D” die Planung im Bauwesen.

RIB Cosinus ist das Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (NAV/Navision)Technologiezentrum in der RIB Gruppe. Unser Spezialgebiet? Wir entwickeln und implementieren ERP-Lösungen auf Basis von Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central – erfolgreich seit 25 Jahren.

Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (NAV/Navision) ist eine Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)-Lösung für alle geschäftlichen Anforderungen in einem Unternehmen. Die Unternehmenssoftware kontrolliert alle Geschäftstätigkeiten von Finanzmanagement und Buchhaltung, Einkauf/Verkauf/Lager, Lieferketten-Management und Fertigung, Vertrieb, Service bis hin zu Projektmanagement.

Im digitalen Zeitalter möchten wir weiterhin jederzeit ideal aufgestellt sein. Für die Durchführung von nationalen und internationalen Kundenprojekten zur Einführung und Integration unserer auf Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central/Microsoft Dynamics NAV basierenden Branchenlösung suchen wir deshalb mehrere Anwendungsentwickler/-in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (m/w/d):

Standorte:
Remote oder Vorort möglich:
Freiburg im Breisgau, Deutschland
Mannheim, Deutschland
Villingen-Schwenningen, Deutschland
Berlin, Deutschland
Zofingen, Schweiz

Ihre Aufgaben:
Konzeptionierung von Lösungen in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Teamleiter der Entwicklung
Analyse, Erstellung von Aufwandsschätzungen und Umsetzung kundenindividueller Geschäftsanforderungen
Entwicklung und Pflege von Schnittstellen zu externen Anwendungen
Konzeptionierung und Durchführung von Datenmigrationen aus Altsystemen
Sicherstellung der Kundenzufriedenheit bei Verwendung der Software
Gelegentlicher Einsatz bei Kunden vor Ort

Ihr Profil:
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im IT-Umfeld
Sehr gute Programmier- und Designkenntnisse in einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache und / oder Routinierter Umgang mit C/AL oder AL (AL-Programmierung: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C/AL), idealerweise Erfahrungen in der RDLC-Reportentwicklung und im Umgang mit Visual Studio Code
Zuverlässige und selbstständige Arbeitsweise, Hands-on-Mentalität sowie schnelles Auffassungsvermögen
Ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit

Wir bieten:
Beteiligung am Unternehmenserfolg
30 Tage Urlaub pro Jahr
Kostenlose Getränke und guter Kaffee
Full Home Office und/oder Präsenz nach Wunsch mit verantwortungsvollem Hygienekonzept und digitalem Workflow
Moderne Hardware und Software für optimales Arbeiten
Firmenfitnessprogramm mit Verbundunternehmen (Hansefit)
JobRad – auch für ein weiteres Familienmitglied (https://www.jobrad.org/)
Ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Eigene Yogamatte zum Entspannen in den Pausen
Welcome-Package: Mit einer Outdoor Jacke und anderen Willkommensgeschenken möchten wir Sie von Anfang an als Teammitglied willkommen heißen
Eine lässige Arbeitsatmosphäre und viel Gestaltungsspielraum innerhalb einer flachen Hierarchie
Ein Anzug oder Kostüm sind bei uns keine Vorschrift
Eine offene, ehrliche Feedbackkultur und kurze, unbürokratische Kommunikationswege
Freiheit zur eigenen Gestaltung und Umsetzung von Ideen
Unbefristeter, sicherer Arbeitsplatz mit persönlichen und fachlichen Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten z. B. Trainings, Coachings, Förderprogramme, Aus- und Weiterbildung
Umfangreiche, individuelle Möglichkeiten zur Weiterbildung im Microsoft Umfeld mit Erhalt von Zertifikaten
Teambuilding - Jährliche Events wie Weihnachtsfeier oder Sommerfeste
Großzügige Büros
Sehr gute Verkehrsanbindung (PKW und öffentliche Verkehrsmittel)
Kostenloser Parkplatz

Job Description

Our client is aiming at managing and transforming the full Information Technology infrastructure underpinning the Commercial Banking Operations in European major countries. Focused on harnessing leading-edge innovation, monitoring trends in the banking and IT industries, and identifying emerging disruptive technologies to be rapidly introduced in production.

Your responsibilities

Solaris System Management

Improve, optimize and support daily business and projects
Design, implementation and administration of development, test and production environments regarding Solaris
2nd and 3rd Level Support for Solaris (Incident-, Problem-, Change-Management)
Implementation of requests in alignment with project manager / client and the Team
Planning, implementation, and administration of the Disaster Recovery infrastructures for systemic applications based on Solaris
Consulting for applications
Provide server installation, configuration and administration
Provide all tasks for system management including patching, hardening, health checking, backup
Provide performance analysis and system tuning on both application and system level
Provide support in the capacity, problem, incident and availability processes
Support on security settings configurations and implementation

Our requirements

Solid knowledge on:

OS Solaris version Solaris 10, Solaris 11
Cluster management
Physical HW x86 / SPARC management
CDOM / LDOM / Global Zones management
Experience on lifecycle projects like migration projects (P2V, V2V) or OS upgrades
Knowledge on scripting
Experience on working with complex environments
General knowledge on LAN/WAN
Good English communication skills, written and spoken
Willingness to participate in 24x7 on-all shifts and to cover activities out of business hours
Good attitude towards working in a global team over different countries and flexibility

Benefits

Remote work ()
Flexible type of employment (COW OR B2B)
Internal Mobility Program – enjoy many opportunities for career growth, job rotations, diversity of projects & technologies
International, diverse, and inclusive working environment – get experience in global projects for worldwide leaders and enjoy multinational teams
Referral Program – enjoy cooperation with your colleagues and get the bonus!
5/10 years NATEK club – we offer long term cooperation and celebrate each fifth year cooperation anniversary with gifts
NATEK CSR Events & team buildings – enjoy our values: accountability, partnership and expertise and #workITwithus
Education – benefit from our know how, learning courses and certificates and IT events – be part of community of leaders of the industry and take part as a speaker or a visitor

Only for CoW:

Relocation Bonus – reimbursement for moving expenses for out-of-town candidates
Bonuses for Personal Events – we congratulate you important events of your life: giving birth to children, university graduation, etc.
Benefit Plus (Cafeteria) – use our e-shop with corporate benefits like travel, theater tickets, books etc.
Additional Medical health care – on top of standard health insurance
Multisport Club Card
Technical and Personal training – we are investing in your skills growthLanguage courses
1 paid day off for volunteering – we are supportive in all charity ideas
Meal contribution/ food vouchers
Recreation bonus – enjoy traveling around Slovakia and get reimbursement of travel costs

We are a digitally native technology services company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use some of the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field to empower organizations in every aspect.

Right now, we are looking for Golang Developers to join our team at Globant!

You Will Get The Chance To
Work with professionals who have created some of the most revolutionary solutions in their fields.
Make an impact. Work in large-scale projects globally.
Develop your career in our Studios. Each Studio represents deep pockets of expertise on the latest technologies and trends and delivers tailored solutions focused on specific challenges.
Develop your career within an industry or multiple industries.
Work in the city you want, and be nourished by cultural exchanges.
Be empowered to choose your career path: we have more than 600 simultaneous projects, so you can choose where and how to work.
Be part of an agile pod. Driven by a culture of self-regulated teamwork, each team -or POD- works directly with our customers with a full maturity path that evolves as they increase speed, quality and autonomy.

What Will Help You Succeed
Believe and love what you do.
Build bridges & open doors.
Enjoy solving problems.
Being capable of taking a step back to look at a bigger picture.
Intermediate English skills.
Good understanding of Golang, especially concurrency, unit testing. Having experience with libraries like gorm, go kit, testify, etc., will be welcome!
Besides Golang, it is very important to have a good background on backend technologies in general, such as are microservices, cloud computing (AWS, GCP, Azure, others), REST, gRPC and Protobuf, Docker, CI/CD, Kubernetes, message brokers, monitoring tools, among others.
Good knowledge on different database engines both, SQL and NoSQL
Keep scalability in mind, always.

At Globant we believe that an inclusive culture and a diverse environment makes us stronger. We encourage people to have an inclusive spirit as our global footprint expands. We seek to generate a place of inspiration and growth for everyone. A safe space, based on equity as a value, where everyone's careers can be promoted and developed in the same way. There is no innovation without diversity and there is no improvement without plurality.

This job be filled from Anywhere in Ecuador.

Are you ready?

Job Segment: Developer, Engineer, Equity, Nursing, Cloud, Technology, Finance, Healthcare, Engineering

Job Segment: Developer, Cloud, Testing, Engineer, Equity, Technology, Finance, Engineering

Project Description:
Our client develops innovative solutions, which are geared towards its customers' requirements in terms of performance, efficiency and investment reliability. Covering markets like Transportation, Energy, Oil&Gas, Manufacturing, Automotive Hirschmann has become the leader in data communication and automation systems offering high quality, high availability line of industrial networking devices and systems. Our projects are including the full cycle of software development, for the entire line of products: starting with BSP and driver development for new HW components, OS integration (both Linux and VxWorks), feature development and integration (L2-L3 Ethernet-based communication protocols or Industrial Protocols), bug fixing and support ending with manual or automated testing using an internal in-house developed framework. Runs on cutting-edge HW platforms designed in-house using the newest technologies from Broadcom, all the software is developed under Agile methodology using a modern continuous integration approach. The local team consists of 65 members organized in 7 Scrum teams. Each team can either take the responsibility of an entire release, including management or work with several teams to the same product line or software release.

Responsibilities:
Feature developing and bug fixing for Client's Industrial Switches Platform family

Mandatory Skills Description:
- Experience in embedded software development, preferably for network equipment
- Experience with C programming on VxWorks/Linux/Unix environments
- Experience with cross compilers, debuggers, etc.
- Good understanding of Ethernet and IP networking
- Familiarity with git
- Knowledge of RTOS application development (VxWorks / NetBSD / Linux)
- Understanding multi-process system software architectures
- Experience with one or more of the following: POSIX threads, SNMP, XML
- Shell Scripting

Nice-to-Have Skills:
-Agile/Scrum experience

We are looking for a Data Engineer responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure and systems that enable the collection, storage, and analysis of large sets of data. This can include tasks such as creating and optimizing data pipelines, designing and implementing data storage solutions, and ensuring data quality and security. Will often work closely with Data Scientists and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and design solutions that meet those needs. Strong technical skills, particularly in programming and database management, are typically required for this role.

Data Engineer mandatory skills and experience
Some essential skills and experience for a Data Engineer include:

Strong programming skills, particularly in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.

Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Apache Kafka.

Proficiency in SQL and experience with database management systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.

Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.

Understanding of data warehousing concepts and data modeling techniques.

Knowledge of data integration, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) processes.

Experience with data governance and data security best practices.

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex systems.

Excellent communication skills, as Data Engineers often need to work closely with other teams and stakeholders.

Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and experience working in a collaborative, cross-functional environment.

Having experience with Machine Learning or Data Science is a plus but not mandatory for the role of Data Engineer.

Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.

As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.

At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.

Department Overview

Motorola Solutions provides trusted security solutions to the global market through its Video Security and Access Control Division. Motorola Solutions designs develop and manufactures video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions. Motorola’s solutions have been installed at thousands of customer sites, including school campuses, transportation systems, healthcare centers, public venues, critical infrastructure, prisons, factories, casinos, airports, financial institutions, government facilities, and retailers.

Job Description

As a member of the Sales Engineering Department, the Sales Engineer will work closely with the Sales Organization to develop and position solutions involving Motorola Solutions products.

The Sales Engineer is responsible for technical aspects of the sales process and works closely with the Sales Department involved to develop and position solutions involving Video Security & Access control Division products, writing specs for tenders, also answering to tenders, driving product tests and complex scenarios and internal/external training among others.

During the needs analysis process, confirm that the products meet the prospect’s requirements and assist in technical qualifications. Throughout the proposal process, articulate the technology and demonstrate Motorola’s solutions to both business and technical users. Position Motorola products relative to competition and formulate system designs that conform to both technical and budgetary requirements.

As this is an international position, international travelling may be required.

Your key responsibilities will include:
Effectively disseminate product knowledge by providing thorough training to Sales Teams when required.
Manufacturing Representatives, Integrators, and End-Users
Support Sales Teams in responding to RFP’s and designing, specifying, and quoting systems
Develop and maintain strong relationships with Sales Teams, customers, and partners
Collaborate with the Technical Support team in providing post-sales support to customers
Have positive attitude and can properly manage time and tasks
Perform related duties as assigned
Validate from a technical point of view any quote delivered by ISR team.
Onsite activities including international travelling when required.

Basic Requirements
5+ years’ experience in Sales Engineering for a technology company
Strong understanding of the video surveillance, body worn cameras and access control market
Self-motivated and focused individual with a passion for technology and an aptitude for customer satisfaction
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in:
English
Excellent presentation skills, especially with remote technologies such as teleconference.
Possesses strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Has a pleasant, friendly style of verbal and written communication
Driving License and Car are a must.

Technical:
Intimate knowledge and experience with Windows troubleshooting tools and techniques
Excellent knowledge of networking principles and IP communication
Experience with computer hardware configuration and troubleshooting
Experience with network equipment configuration and troubleshooting

Preference will be given to candidates with the following skills and experience:
Experience in access control
College degree or diploma of technology
Prior experience in surveillance industry
Microsoft and/or Cisco certifications
Certification for any competitive products

Travel Requirements

Relocation Provided

Position Type

Referral Payment Plan

No

Mission
Après une période d’observation et d’apprentissage des outils utilisés ainsi que des spécificités d’Edusign, tu participeras au développement technique des plateformes web et APIs.

Les tâches des développeurs chez Edusign
Nos APIs et connecteurs,
Le développement front-end de nos applications web et mobiles,
Nos bases de données (MySQL Aurora),
Tu participeras aux décisions techniques stratégiques, ainsi qu'à la roadmap avec le reste de l'équipe,
Notre infrastructure (AWS) : cyber-sécurité, scaling et optimisation,
Maintenir la documentation interne et définir les bonnes pratiques de codage.

Tu travailleras plus précisément et principalement sur les connecteurs et API de nos partenaires ERP et logiciels de visio-conférence.

Stack
- Front : Angular (90%), VueJs (10%)
- Back : Nodejs/Typescript
- DB : MySQL
- Architecture : AWS EC2, Aurora, ECS (Fargate/Docker), Loadbalancers, WAF,...

Profil recherché
Tu as :
au minimum 2 ans d'expérience en développement web avec Javascript, et plus particulièrement avec les frameworks Angular & Nodejs (fullstack),
idéalement déjà travaillé avec l'infrastructure AWS & l'environnement Linux,
Tu as des bases en design et en expérience utilisateur (UX).
Tu es :
Sensible aux bonnes pratiques de développement
Débrouillard
Un.e bosseur.euse
Curieux.euse
Force de proposition
Mais surtout le principal : Tu es passionné.e !

Tu penses être apte à réaliser la mission ? Tu es la personne que l'on recherche !
Travailler chez Edusign, c'est faire partie d'un projet récent et d'une équipe jeune et ambitieuse.
Nous sommes basés à Station F à Paris. Télétravail en grande partie/totalité possible.
Rémunération définie en fonction de tes compétences.

Travailler chez Edusign c'est :
Une balance pro/perso grâce au télétravail et aux libertés d'horaires de travail.
Des locaux sympathiques à Station F (Paris 13) si tu souhaites venir en présentiel.
Une équipe sympathique avec qui partager un apéro après le travail.
Des points en visio dans nos bureaux virtuels, qui rendent les visios agréables et fun.

Glue es una empresa atípica, y lo es porque el equipo está en el centro de todo. Sacar lo mejor de cada uno y ayudar a que todos exploten su potencial al máximo es seguramente una de las cosas que mejor hemos hecho. Esta es la esencia de Glue Digital y lo que nos permite, aun siendo pequeños, ayudar a titanes en sus proyectos más relevantes. Actualmente estamos buscando un dev full stack Senior para integrarse en uno de nuestros mejores proyectos.

Responsabilidades:

Escribirás, revisarás y mantendrás código principalmente en lenguajes JS y JAVA, con bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales, arquitecturas hexagonales y grandes volúmenes de datos.
Trabajarás con el equipo de diseño para construir nuevos productos y nuevas funcionalidades.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Salario competitivo + Incentivos + Shares de las startups que ayudamos a construir.
Trabaja desde donde quieras, Glue Digital es Full Remote.
Seguro médico opcional.
Posibilidad de asistir a eventos internacionales 4YFN, MWC Americas, Websummit, Rise...
Buen ambiente de trabajo, buenas herramientas, poca deuda técnica y proyectos interesantes.
Trabajarás con buenxs diseñadorxs, arquitectxs, developers y project managers, en algunos de los mejores proyectos de algunas de las compañías más grandes del mundo.
Trabajarás en algunos de los topics tecnológicos mas interesantes (Big and Small, Data, PWAs, DLTs, Orquestaciones de Docker y Kubernetes...)
Glue Digital es una empresa naturalmente inclusiva, nos gusta el talento diverso y apoyamos la diversidad en (casi) todas sus formas. Intentamos que sea un lugar donde todo el mundo sea como quiere ser y donde convertise en la mejor version de unx mismx.
Glue tiene una rotación mínima, de las más bajas del sector, esto es por la enorme flexibilidad del entorno, nos adecuamos a tu vida y te dejamos desarrollarla como tú quieras, sin estupideces, puedes trabajar con el equipo que quieras, desde donde quieras y en casi el horario que quieras, solo tienes que hacerlo bien.

Qué pedimos

Al menos 4 años de experiencia desarrollando aplicaciones web.
Experiencia trabajando con frameworks Javascript preferiblemente React (con Redux, Hooks...).
Experiencia con Java Spring Boot.
Experiencia trabajando con bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales.
Experiencia trabajando con GIT, control de versiones, pruebas y Lints, así como otras herramientas de análisis de código.
Interés en el testing, TDD, arquitectura hexagonal y código limpio.
También valoraremos la buena actitud hacia el trabajo y el buen trato. Lo más importante en Glue es el equipo, mantenerlo sano y equilibrado es un trabajo diario del que también formarás parte.
Todo el equipo valorará que te esfuerces por en el trato con los demás, las relaciones son muy importantes, si además de todo lo demás eres unx tipx divertidx pues mejor que mejor.

Why Infosys
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation.

With nearly four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a leading customer engagement company, creating digital experiences powered by Curiously Human AI. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.

You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself.

Overview

We are part of the Unified Messaging Service (UMS) team. UMS is the main backend messaging platform for LivePerson. It manages asynchronous messaging, but is also involved with auto-messaging, shift schedule management, file upload URL requests, and more. As part of this team, we support three application named Controller Bot, Media Handler, and a messaging SDK. Controller bots handle automated messaging for UMS clients. These bots are programmed and directly managed by the clients themselves, but the ownership related to ensuring their functionality is encapsulated here. Media Handler uploads and downloads of files via UMS. And Messaging SDK is a Node.js pass-through layer for internal and external developers to call UMS APIs.

You Will
Produce and inspire high-quality, well-tested code that is easy to read and maintain. Use technical knowledge to build new features, maintain the platform's stability at LivePerson's scale
Use the latest technologies for our customers on a massive scale
Focus on production readiness including root cause analysis, testing, monitoring, and documentation
Contribute to the team's on-call rotation to improve incident coverage
Work with 1-2 teams and work on important functionalities
Design small to mid-level applications and coordinate with other engineers on the team to build scalable solutions
Attend scrum ceremonies such as sprint grooming, sprint planning, and retrospective, and showcase technical solutions to the team
You Have
Must have at least 1 years of experience on Node.JS
Experience or working knowledge with Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Java, AWS and JavaScript
Benefits
Health: medical, dental, and vision
Time away: 28 vacation days
Development: Native AI learning
Additional: Food Vouchers, monthly phone and internet allowance.
Why You'll Love Working Here

Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces.

Belonging At LivePerson

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

Mirai es una fintech. Nuestro conocimiento funcional del sector financiero sumado a una amplia experiencia en proyectos tecnológicos nos permite dar soluciones innovadoras a diferentes retos de negocio.
De la mano de un profundo conocimiento del sector y rodeados de un equipo enfocado a la innovación y la excelencia técnica, nació nuestro producto MAT– Mirai ALM Tool – que es una solución nativa en cloud para la gestión de riesgos financieros, concretamente del riesgo estructural de balance o ALM.
Actualmente MAT está implantado y en pleno rendimiento en diferentes clientes a nivel nacional e internacional, y nos encontramos en fase de expansión.
Somos un equipo multidisciplinar especializado tanto en el sector financiero como en todas las capas de un producto digital [diseño, front-end, back-end, data science, big data e infraestructura]. Si algo nos caracteriza como equipo, es la orientación a la calidad y la mejora continua, por eso MAT está en constante desarrollo adaptándolo y actualizándolo a las últimas tecnologías, así como desarrollando múltiples funcionalidades para dar un servicio cada vez más especializado y de mayor calidad a cada uno de nuestros clientes.
Queremos incorporar una persona proactiva con responsabilidades cross a todos los equipos. Punto de encuentro para las mejoras de seguridad y vulnerabilidades, tanto descubiertas por agentes externos como desde sus labores de pentesting.

¿Qué buscamos?

Purple team!
Buenas prácticas de securización de entornos cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Buenas prácticas de desarrollo (OWASP).
Buenas prácticas en desarrollo de software con GIT (gitflow, github-flow, PR, etc).
Conocimientos de pentesting.
Conocimientos en seguridad de contenedores (Docker, Kubernetes, RBAC, ABAC).
Conocimientos de compliance: políticas, legislación y auditoría de seguridad.
Plus: Conocimientos de Zero-Trust.
Plus: JVM y seguridad en Java.
Plus: CKS.
Plus: Supply chain security.

¿Qué vas a hacer?

Se trata de un rol transversal dentro de los equipos, con responsabilidades tanto en entorno Cloud como a nivel global.

Entorno Cloud:

Conocer las herramientas de análisis y auditoría de los principales proveedores cloud (AWS mínimo).
Pentesting a nivel código e infraestructura.
Análisis de la infraestructura y código para mejorar la seguridad.
White box testing.
Análisis y clasificación de alertas de seguridad.
Aplicación de cambios relativos a seguridad dentro de AWS (IAM/SSO/etc).
Reportar a los distintos equipos las vulnerabilidades descubiertas.
Coordinar con el management los tiempos de resolución de vulnerabilidades.

Entorno Global:

Promocionar las buenas prácticas de seguridad en los equipos.
Verificar el compliance: políticas, legislación y auditoría de seguridad.
Administración de las distintas herramientas de seguridad dentro de la compañía.
Apoyo ante incidentes de seguridad, planes de contingencia.

¿Por qué Mirai?

Contrato indefinido, ¡buscamos relaciones a largo plazo!
Crecimiento personal y profesional, estamos constantemente actualizándonos y enfrentándonos a nuevos retos.
Creemos e impulsamos la innovación y la excelencia técnica.
Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
“Work from anywhere” Tú decides desde donde trabajas: 100% remote, 50%, etc.
Cursos de inglés, certificaciones punteras y formación a medida.
Retribución flexible con COBEE (transporte, restaurantes y guardería).
Seguro médico y dental 100% financiado por la empresa. Well-being package.
Hasta 29 días de vacaciones al año.
Salario competitivo.

Mirai ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acepta solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad y no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación sexual o Identidad de género, o cualquier otra base según lo protegido por la ley vigente.

¡Hola! Soy Víctor, cofundador de Planet 🌍, la única plataforma de automatización y gestión de precios para Shopify en español. Actualmente contamos con más de 500 clientes, con presencia en ¡+65 países diferentes!

Por ello, estamos ampliando nuestro equipo con un programador Front-end para el desarrollo de nuevas funcionalidades para nuestra plataforma. 💻🤙🏻

Qué ofrecemos:
Una oportunidad de escapar de los desarrollos monolíticos. Cada mes lanzamos una funcionalidad nueva, dando pie a progresar con tus conocimientos de desarrollo, y evitar la monotonía de hacer las mismas tareas una y otra vez.
Una organización horizontal donde se tienen en cuenta las diversas opiniones e ideas a la hora de tomar decisiones.
Un entorno de trabajo distendido al máximo. Nos consideramos una familia, y basamos nuestra cultura en la confianza y la cercanía 😊.
El mejor sitio para crecer. Avanzamos rápido, experimentando y aprendiendo juntos.
Horario flexible elegido por la persona. Trabajo por sprints, basado en metodología Scrum.
Salario: 23-27k€ anuales.

Qué puedes esperar de tus primeros meses en Planet:
El primer mes te pondrás a punto para poder desarrollar: aprenderás a usar nuestra plataforma y conocerás sus puntos fuertes y mejorables, prepararás tu entorno de desarrollo y aprenderás a usar las herramientas que tenemos en Front. Podrás ver cómo nos coordinamos e incluso haber colaborado en alguna tarea de desarrollo menor.
En el segundo mes habrás desplegado cambios menores en nuestro sistema de diseño y nuestras extensiones de Shopify con la ayuda de tu mentor.
En el tercer mes te habrás enfrentado a una tarea de desarrollo dentro de nuestra plataforma y para las extensiones de Shopify. Será un mes donde experimentarás a fondo con los stacks de cada entorno.
Al cabo de seis meses esperamos que ya sepas qué se puede y no se puede hacer con la API de Shopify, que participes en el diseño de nuevos addons y que puedas afrontar nuevos desarrollos en la plataforma (siempre con la ayuda de tus compañeros :)).
El objetivo final es que con el tiempo lideres el desarrollos de addons para la sección de automatizaciones, proponiendo soluciones que se adapten a los requisitos y limitaciones de Shopify.

Requisitos técnicos:
Conocimientos demostrables en el desarrollo con Angular o dos años de experiencia laboral en desarrollo web.
El prototipado se desarrolla en Figma y se maqueta en HTML5 y SCSS. Disponemos de una línea de diseño para simplificar este proceso.
Conocimientos básicos de patrones de diseño e interés por desarrollar código que sea fácil de mantener.
La mayor parte de los desarrollos parten de cero, por lo que priman las buenas prácticas. Esto permite ir actualizando las versiones sobre una base sólida y robusta para todo el equipo.
Experiencia con Git.
Conocimientos básicos de MongoDB.
MongoDB es nuestro motor de BBDD principal por lo que cualquier funcionalidad que desarrolles pasará por comunicarte con ella.
Para pruebas, debbuging e incidencias será necesario consultar directamente a la base de datos, por lo que, si tienes experiencia previa te resultará de gran ayuda.
No es necesario conocer todas las tecnologías de nuestro stack, pero sí especial interés por aprender y trabajar con ellas. En el día a día, desarrollarás en Angular@14, pero entrarás en contacto con nuestra infraestructura de AWS, sistema de logs y demás tecnologías.

También, es deseable:
Nos gustan las personas resolutivas, que no tengan miedo a enfrentarse a nuevas situaciones y a trabajar desde la terminal.
El interés por explorar todos los campos y tecnologías es algo esencial; siempre estamos buscando cómo optimizar nuestros procesos, aunque implique integrarnos con otras plataformas o usar otras librerías.
El inglés es algo esencial. Desarrollarás funcionalidad para una plataforma que se usa por todo el mundo; por lo que ayudar en la internacionalización de los textos y tener en cuenta el formateo de números y moneda es parte del día a día.

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else – with class, logical thinking and lots of style 😎 Let’s break it down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers 🚀 If you’re thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, don’t worry - that’s not how we do things. They’re some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions 🤘

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We’re looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! It’s a big task, but you won’t do it alone. 💪

You’ll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects that’ll make our company move forward ⏩

What You’ll Be Doing
Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
Collaborating with product owners, engineers and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems

What You'll Need
Experience building and leading a significant data science team within a scaling organisation
Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools.
Deep understanding of fundamentals of probability and statistics.
Big picture thinking - correctly diagnosing problems and productionising research.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads

Nice to have
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Masters or PhD)
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
Previous experience in anti fraud departments
Experience working at a large tech company worth >$15B
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Job Description Summary
Provide technical support the New Unit Spares projects during their ITO and OTR phase by defining part numbers for the Customers' specific lists, handling the engineering activities on the lines related to the NUS project in the ERP and coordinating with the CM Services team, the NUS PM team and the customer representatives to keep the NUS project on track.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

Support the NUS proposals in ITO (or pre-ITO) - either refining the templates used by the NUS PMs to create the proposals, or defining part numbers to the Customer specific scope using the BoM of similar units
Support the NUS projects in OTR to define part numbers to the Customer specific scope using the BoM of the actual unit, handling undefined lines in ERP for extra scope of the NUS projects, and making part-to-unit verifications for certain items like GT capitals on Sales Order lines in ERP
Coordinate the efforts of the CM Services team and the NUS PMs regarding the support of NUS projects in OTR
Cooperate with the customer facing team, or even the customers to clarify what the Customer intended to be included in their special scope.
The NUS part engineer is expected to assess their load and ask for additional resources within CM Services - PGS team to cope with sudden spikes in the load.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in Engineering;
Proven experience in similar role;
Fluent English is a must.

Desired Characteristics

Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs.
Product knowledge on leg-GE technologies (GT, GEN, ST) and some leg-ALS STs, including their F2F portions, the auxiliaries, BOP and HRSG.
Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

This is a remote position

We are a startup based in Madrid, and the top digital platform for online parking in Europe. We book customers their parking space in the city center, at airports and at train stations, and we do it at an unbeatable price with discounts that reach up to 70% off the original retail price. We also allow our clients to pay the parking meter in Barcelona and Madrid, and soon in many other European cities. We currently have more than 1 million users and we operate in 8 countries and more than 240 cities.

Our mission is not only to digitize the world of parking, but also to offer everyone at Parclick an incredible opportunity to work and learn at a proper start-up with brilliant colleagues and continuous challenges.

We are looking for a B2B Business Developer Assistant to join our Partnership team. The B2B and Partnership department together with the trade marketing department focuses its efforts on helping those companies willing to add value to their products or services by reselling our products. The channel that gives us the highest satisfaction is certainly B2B and B2B2C, and we achieve it through various technological solutions.
Our most faithful partners are companies operating in the tourism and hotel sectors. But that's not all. Opportunities arise in the market every day, and our job is to analyze and value them on the basis of an opportunity-cost approach. The Partnership department at Parclick will help partners achieve their business goals and, at the same time position our products on the market, making Parclick the most successful brand in its sector.

Responsibilities

Lead, structure and execute projects with a high level of ownership and freedom with a strong focus on success.
Managing existent partners portfolio in Parclick’s B2B markets of action through customer care (phone calls, email or in person if needed).
Identify and build long lasting relationships with strategic partners.
Developing existing and new distribution channels.
Analyze business opportunities and risks, conducting market researches and lead qualification/calling.
Prospecting new business opportunities/partners to grow in the events area.
Independently managing partners from lead generation to contract signature.
Prospect new possible partners or business segments by actively looking for new opportunities.
Participating in events and fairs as a Parclick Ambassador.
Coordinate, manage and solve partners issues.
Content generation.

Qualifications
We’re looking for a candidate with a positive and proactive attitude.
You have the capacity to work independently although always surrounded by your colleagues.
2 or more years of sales experience.
Fluent Spanish speaker. Good working knowledge of Spanish and English.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Outstanding communication, negotiation and influencing skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and confidence is approaching and discussing solutions and products with strangers.
Able to multitask.
Ability to work to targets and KPI’s and self-monitor own performance.
Analytical and strategic planning skills.
International and multicultural perspective.
Entrepreneurial mindset.
Availability to travel.

We highly Value
French and/or Italian as a second language will be highly valued.
Previous experiences in a b2b environment prospecting and/or managing business accounts.
Previous experience with a CRM.
Previous experience in marketing and designing tools.
Knowledge of the parking and tourism industry.
Ability to get to know people, build and maintain meaningful professional relationships.
A results-oriented approach to work.
This job is 100% remote but it will be highly valued if you are based in Barcelona or Madrid.

We offer:
Flexible schedule.
Competitive salary based on experience and a bonus based on results.
Remote work.
The chance to work in a motivating and open environment with talented colleagues that you can learn a lot from.
5 days available to attend training and seminars of your choice in the company.
Company culture based on open communication— everybody has the chance to contribute and take part in the conversation.
25 Days of paid vacation.

If you think you are a good match for this position and our company, send us your application now! We look forward to hearing from you. We will get back to you as soon as possible with extra details and questions. Further information will be addressed in an interview.

Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do
Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do
Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software

#Stack

We are DEUS EX MACHINA, a technology company specializing in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and analytics. Our client roster includes Fortune 100 organizations and startups. We strive to develop solutions that make a positive impact. At DEUS, we are passionate about building innovative solutions that empower our clients to succeed and grow. At the core of our successful track record are our people, our commitment to client success, and our desire to make an impact through a creative, focused, and collaborative mentality.
Role Description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Data Scientist with strong overall professional skills and experience to join our team in Athens or Thessaloniki, full-time. We are looking for people with knowledge and previous experience in advanced Machine Learning (any end-to-end solution), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Neural Networks and Graph Theory (Algorithms and Structures) to support business initiatives and product development.
As a Data Scientist, you will be part of the Data Science team and report to the Data Science Team Leader. You will be joining a talented team of Data Scientists, Engineers, Bioinformaticians and Product Managers working on state-of-the-art technology products and solutions.
Job Description and Key Responsibilities:
Actively contribute to the development and maintenance of our customer-centric AI-powered products and solutions.
Organize and monitor various data collection procedures to identify patterns and enhance the decision making process based on the projects’ objectives.
Conduct statistical analysis and interpret the results.
Implement and optimize ML models to extract useful information/insights from various data sources.
Participate in architectural discussions and decisions
Work closely with other functional teams to lead ideas to production.
Present solutions and results to the team and to other stakeholders.
Identify and propose opportunities which can drive advanced business solutions.
Job Features:
Machine Learning: ANN, SVM, Bayesian, Clustering, Regression, Reinforcement Learning, Active Learning
Artificial Intelligence: Knowledge Bases, Decisions support tool development, AI Algorithms, Large Language Models (LLMs)
Programming: Python, Sci-kit learn, Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch
Required Qualifications:
MSc. or Ph.D. (Preferred) in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or related fields.
Prior hands-on working experience in advanced Data Science projects. Of particular interest is expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Large Language Models (GPT, BERT, etc.), Relation Extraction, Attention-based models, and Graph Analytics.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Excellent Data analytics and Machine Learning skills.
Excellent oral and written skills in Greek and English.
Excellent technical writing skills and research experience are a plus.
What is it like to work with us:
DEUS EX MACHINA will provide you with resources and advanced tools necessary to deliver best-in-class results for our clients, in a workplace that inspires collaboration and creativity. Our people are the most important asset and we always strive for providing them with a good working-life balance. What to expect working at DEUS:
Competitive compensation packages based on qualifications.
Flexible work schedule
Professional and personal development opportunities
Private life & health insurance
Room to experiment, learn and have fun
Peers with big smiles and fascinating ideas
A multi-disciplinary, multinational team that values trust and autonomy
If you like the description above, we are looking forward to receiving your application. Please apply with your latest CV in English.

Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

We’re looking for an (Associate) Data Scientist with 1-3 years of experience in a top tier consultancy or in a high-tech company to join our global Strategy and Business Operations team and help envision our long-term growth plans.

Your Role in Action

Build advanced predictive models for essential metrics to inform management decisions
Conduct advanced data analysis and coordinate with other teams to gather applicable insight related to business operations as well as market dynamics
Partner with department heads and other leaders in the business to complete advanced projects where data science contributes
Master the data ecosystem in the company and can provide insights on how to use it
Support portions of our annual strategic planning process (important goals, budgeting)

Your Skills

Hands-on experience in the practical application of statistical methods, including causal inference and predictive modeling
You feel comfortable working with complex SQL queries and python (pandas/numpy/sklearn/statsmodels)
You love digging into data with the ultimate goal of problem solve for big, challenging strategic questions
You can quickly distill actionable insights from varied sources and often incomplete data
Ability to independently multi-task, efficiently prioritize tasks, and drive projects to completion in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
Ability to interact with all levels of the organization and across a variety of cultures
You thrive with regular feedback and are hungry to learn
1-3years of data science experience in a business setting
Educational background in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, computer science or econometrics
Extra credits for hands-on experience in Big Data frameworks (Databricks, Snowflake, BigQuery)

Parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Long-term incentive program

Training investment program

Wideo, obraz i zdolność widzenia to ogromne źródło informacji dla nas - ludzi. W Noctuai pracujemy nad tym, by było ono dostępne również dla świata maszyn.

Jeżeli chcesz do nas dołączyć i tworzyć rozwiązania AI Vision, które już dziś pomagają dbać o bezpieczeństwo ludzi, infrastruktury, czy czy ograniczać emisję metanu, to jest do tego dobra okazja - rekrutujemy!

Pracujemy od podstaw nad rozwojem innowacyjnego rozwiązania, a Twój wkład będzie istotny już od samego początku.

Razem z Nami Będziesz

prowadzić research i brainstorming pomysłów rozwiązań z zakresu Computer Vision,
tworzyć wymagania dotyczące danych syntetycznych oraz danych pozyskiwanych od klienta,
przygotowywać zbiory danych,
tworzyć skrypty/repozytoria researchowe,
trenować i ewaluować modele uczenia głębokiego,
tworzyć wizualizacje i analizy wyników, propozycje ulepszeń,
wyciągać wnioski i tworzyć raporty z przeprowadzonych badań nad modelami/rozwiązaniami z zakresu uczenia głębokiego.

Niezbędne Do Tego Są

doświadczenie z narzędziami tj.: Python, PyTorch, OpenCV, TensorFlow, NumPy, Pandas, Git,
znajomość zagadnień dotyczących uczenia głębokiego,
znajomość Computer Vision (klasyfikacja, detekcja, segmentacja),
znajomość zagadnień statystycznych oraz umiejętności analityczne,
znajomość rozwiązania SOTA (State-of-the-art) z obszaru Computer Vision,
doświadczenie w researchu z zakresu rozwiązań Computer Vision,
logicznie myślenie i kreatywne rozwiązywanie problemów,
sprawne znajdywanie rozwiązań i inspiracji w dostępnych publikacjach naukowych oraz umiejętność wdrożenia ich
swobodna komunikacja w języku polskim.

Mile Widziane

rozumienie zagadnień związanych z procesowaniem strumieni wideo,
dobre kompetencje komunikacyjne (dawanie i przyjmowanie konstruktywnej krytyki).

Wierzymy, że dzięki dobrej współpracy razem osiągamy więcej. Dlatego:

wspieramy rozwój - co miesiąc 300 zł, które możesz wydawać na książki, konferencje, szkolenia. Dla chętnych lekcje angielskiego.
pracujesz tak jak lubisz - mamy dwa biura: w centrum Warszawy oraz w Pomorskim Parku Naukowo Technologicznym w Gdyni. Jeżeli wolisz, możesz pracować zdalnie. Dla niezdecydowanych - model hybrydowy.
wynagrodzenie w przedziale 15 000 - 22 000 zł brutto na UoP,
wspólnie świętujemy nasze sukcesy w czasie spotkań integracyjnych,
dbamy o Twoje zdrowie - zapewniamy pakiety medyczne (do wyboru Medicover lub Luxmed) oraz kartę Multisport,
udostępniamy firmową bibliotekę - w biurze oraz wirtualną.

Czeka Cię Prosty i Szybki Proces Rekrutacyjny

krótka rozmowa telefoniczna z Beatą z zespołu Human Capital,
zdalna rozmowa techniczna z Łukaszem i Michałem (to z nimi będziesz pracować),
zdalna rozmowa z naszym CEO,
decyzja,
jak wszystko pójdzie ok - Witamy w Noctuai!

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Our Risk team sits at the very core of Revolut. Those special agents work across functions, products, and regions to monitor front-line performance and ensure that the business is on safe footing 🕶️ People in the Risk team are among the first in the company to get involved in new business initiatives, from App Technology, through Treasury and Finance, to Customer Support 💫

Our model risk framework is focused on those models which are most business-critical for the purposes of business decision-making, financial reporting, and compliance with regulatory requirements.

As our customer base has grown in recent years, so has the use of models. We are expanding our team to service that growth.

We’re looking for a Risk Manager to manage Revolut’s model risk 📣 A great data and analytics lover with strong emphasis on ML/AI applications to computer vision, AML/ATF, and fraud detection. Someone who’ll dare to challenge our modeling processes and take them to the next level 🏋🏼‍♂️

Up for jumping on board? Let’s get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing
Providing senior management and the Board Risk & Compliance Committee with periodic key insight on material models
Identifying improvements to modeling processes and methodologies and assign reliable model risk ratings
Providing recommendations to model developers to help them keep the incidence of adverse outcomes caused by the use of material models to within our model risk appetite
Embedding strong model risk management practices end-to-end across the model lifecycle
Increasing senior management understanding of model assumptions, limitations, outputs, and overlays using available multi-channel distribution tools

What You'll Need
Ability to work autonomously with the confidence to engage individuals at all levels;
Evidence of having validated and/or developed any of the following model types: Market Risk, Credit Risk, Liquidity Risk, Capital Risk, Finance & Treasury models, Financial Crime models, Data science models
Competence in the machine learning techniques
Working knowledge in Python and SQL languages
Knowledge of legislation and regulations relating to model risk management in the UK, USA, and EU
Ability to work under pressure and communicate effectively with the key stakeholders

Nice to have
Working knowledge of C/C++ / Docker languages

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Location: Nürnberg, DE, 90411

Job Requisition ID: 6303

Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.

General Information

We - the Data Science Solutions Unit at SCHAEFFLER are looking for you! We create user-centric digital solutions that we also use internationally. In doing so, we use one of the most important assets of our company: data!

We - that are several agile teams consisting of colleagues from all over the world with the highest expertise in the areas of data science, artificial intelligence & machine learning, holistic user experience, cloud computing & software engineering, integration & architecture.

Award-winning applications speak for our success.

We are also happy to receive applications from interested Young Professionals (m/f/d).

Your Key Responsibilities
Create, deploy and operate Data Science Solutions in the context of machine lifetime analysis as part of a cross-functional, agile product team
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders and condition monitoring specialists
Carry out time series data analyses for the prediction of machine states
Research scientific papers and apply relevant techniques to industry problems along with thorough validation of results
Become a fully-committed member of a product team which takes ownership of new AI services from literature research to model serving
Become an active part of our strong Data Science Solutions department where exchange and networking beyond team borders is a welcome source of inspiration

Your Qualifications
Completed degree in (business) informatics, mathematics or comparable qualification
Ideally some years of professional experience in the field of statistics, vibration analysis and time series analysis, gladly acquired through relevant internships
Knowledge of signal processing, hypothesis testing, Bayesian modelling, lifetime analysis
Sound knowledge of Python and relevant libraries (e. g. pandas, numpy, tf , statsmodel, scipy, scikit-learn)
Understanding of basic programming principles and modern DevOps Tooling are required e. g. SQL, Git, Docker, Jenkins
First experience in the creation, deployment and operation of AI services, ideally in an API-first approach
Experience with running machine learning experiments on the cloud and using AzureML services for results and artefacts traceability would be preferred, also usage of Azure Synapse analytics is plus
Past experience with big data analyses will be an advantage, ideally in the context of condition monitoring
Knowledge of NLP methods is a plus as well as of model maintenance (data drift/ model drift) in production would be helpful
Very good knowledge of spoken and written English, German is a plus
Open to new cloud technologies and data science methods and continuously striving to improve
Distinct analytical competence, ability to concentrate and communication skills paired with an agile and product-oriented mindset

As a global company with employees around the world, it is important to us that we treat each other with respect and value all ideas and perspectives. By appreciating our differences, we inspire creativity and drive innovation. In this way, we contribute to sustainable value creation for our stakeholders and society as a whole. Together, we advance how the world moves.

Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your online application.
