About Inscribe

Inscribe is a Series B company backed by $38M in venture capital from seasoned Silicon Valley investors like Threshold Ventures, Crosslink Capital, Uncork Capital, and Y Combinator, along with angel investors including Box co-founder Dylan Smith and Intercom co-founder Des Traynor.

We’re on a mission to create a fair and efficient financial services ecosystem — one that grants more access to “thin file” customers (who have traditionally been left behind) while keeping fraudsters out. Companies that use Inscribe are able to grow faster, reduce fraud, and serve more customers with a better experience.

It’s a lofty goal, but one that our team of kind, funny, and wildly talented people from across the globe are committed to. We put people first by fostering an environment that is inclusive of diverse backgrounds, encouraging a sustainable work-life balance, and ensuring our team members have the resources and support to grow. Plus, our work anniversary gifts can’t be beat: poems, portraits, and (yes, it’s true) custom crossword puzzles created in your honor.

What about our company values? We’re glad you asked:
We’re builders: We create things that move society forward and let our work speak for itself.
We’re here to win: We know where we’re going, and nothing will stop us from getting there.
We’re kind: We’re human. We crave to understand others and to be understood.
We have fun: We believe joy unlocks curiosity, creativity, and connection.

We work with some of the fastest-growing fintechs in the world, such as TripActions, Ramp, Bluevine, Shift, and more. While we’re a remote-first company, we have HQs in San Francisco and Dublin, Ireland.

The Opportunity

As a Software Engineer at Inscribe you’ll apply your technical knowledge to solve real customer problems. You’ll join our Credit Team and work closely with product managers, designers, machine learning experts and other engineers. You’ll build new features for our API and Integrations. You’ll get involved in all aspects of the product development lifecycle - ideation, design, deployment, support and product evolution/iteration.

Responsibilities
Build and operate a SaaS product
Build new Credit Analysis features exposed through our API
Collaborate with your Credit product team
Listen to the needs of our industry leading fintech customers
Write clean code
Suggest and plan features
Tackle security implications during design and implementation

About You
Have a strong sense of product design, customer empathy and intuition about customer needs
Have 3+ years professional experience as a Software Engineer
Value a high degree of team autonomy and accountability
Are thoughtful about code quality and software architecture
Have built APIs and integrated with third party APIs
Are familiar with Python and Django or similar programming languages and frameworks
Have experience across the testing pyramid
Have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or another relevant field

Nice to Have
Are familiar with Machine Learning and how to expose it as a product
Have experience integrating with Open Banking APIs
Have experience working with or for Fintechs

We’re a remote-first organization with an annual company-wide offsite and regular co-working opportunities in SF and Dublin.

Benefits

At Inscribe, we are building a company and culture where everyone can produce their best work. Here are a few of our awesome benefits:
Competitive salary and meaningful equity
Comprehensive healthcare

Company Overview

Founded in 2010, Lynx Analytics is a predictive analytics company run by world-class quantitative marketing scientists and industry-experienced data scientists. Our focus is to become a leading analytics solution provider in our chosen fields of expertise (telecom, retail, life sciences, and financial services) while advancing graph analytics technology.

Lynx is headquartered in Singapore with operations in Hong Kong, Germany, USA, Hungary, South Africa, Indonesia, and several other Southeast Asian countries. We work with some of the world's largest companies and are constantly looking to expand our knowledge base and geographical footprint. Lynx Analytics' technology is deployed with various Clients across Asia and has significant growth potential.

We have a diverse and inclusive global team comprising Professors, PhDs, MSc's, and MBAs from Ivy Leagues, INSEAD and NUS with a broad spectrum of experience in start-ups and blue-chip companies (Google, SAP, Vodafone, GE, Morgan Stanley, Barclays, HSBC to name but a few). It is the combination of our industry insight and experience, scalable proprietary technology, and highly qualified people that drives our compelling value proposition.

We are looking for ambitious, innovative, empathetic and relentless team players to explore the career opportunities that we offer as we continue to scale our operations.

As a Data Engineer, you will work on automating and productizing advanced big data transformation and analytics pipelines. You would be working with standard big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, etc) as well as our proprietary big graph analysis framework.

Key responsibilities will include:
Understand deeply the business problem we are trying to solve by our analytical solution
Through continuous consultations with employees of our client, discover the client's existing data sources that are relevant to the problem we try to solve
Working together with the IT teams of the client, define the technical architecture for the analytical solution that we are to deploy for the client
Implement the data ingestion subsystem and the data analysis pipelines
Integrate the results into business UIs developed by Lynx or pre-existing client software systems

To succeed in this role, you will have extensive experience in data engineer or data science role, preferably in an analytics or machine-learning environment (or relevant organisation). You should have strong programming skills, including a thorough knowledge of Python and good understanding of the Linux OS and databases (SQL). You need to have analytical thinking with very strong problem-solving skills and be able to undertake travel as required (up to 50%, within the region). Additionally, experience in project delivery is a strong advantage.

Description

At Blueground, our vision is to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. For us, that means ensuring our guests have the peace of mind, flexibility & confidence they need to explore life’s latest adventure.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013, having raised more than $258m+ in funding, to date -- and that’s just the beginning. We’re now hosting guests in more than 11,000 homes in 30 cities around the world (and growing!), with an aim to hit 50 cities by 2025.

Our vision comes to life through our ways of working. For our 1,100+ member team located across 16 countries, we’ve created a culture of collaboration, inclusiveness, and opportunity.

We believe our people should have the power to choose their preferred way to work. Depending on the role’s requirements, team members can choose to work full time in one of our offices, work fully remote, or choose a hybrid model between the two.

We are driven by our core values. To our team, Time is our most important resource. Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our guests and colleagues. Our relationships are built around Transparency, which builds trust and improves communication.

We’re shaping the future of living, and we want you to be part of that journey.

We are looking for a talented Software Development Engineer in Test to join our Engineering team in Athens and work on our business critical backend services.

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on testability, robustness and performance on our products with a well established development methodology, a robust CI pipeline, solid engineering practices and challenging requirements (you won't get bored).

Our Stack

Kotlin | Javascript | Typescript
Spring Boot
Node
Postgres | MongoDB | Redis
RabbitMq
Spock | Jest | Cypress.io
Rest | GraphQL
Docker | AWS | k8s on EKS
Serverless

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog.

What You'll Do

Setting up, maintaining and performing test automation frameworks on multiple application platforms, such as Mobile and Web and building test scenarios and acceptance tests
Understanding feature specifications, system requirements and product objectives to create and execute test cases
Analyzing and disintegrating software system and coordinating with other teams to enhance the overall design
Researching test tools, frameworks and trends in order to upgrade existing processes
Be responsible for the final quality on production release

What To Expect

To work in agile, cross functional, DevOps enabled teams
To work with a product manager and an engineer in test
To work on functional and non functional testing
To work on performance
To test challenging integration scenarios
To enjoy some quality engineering
A rapidly growing company
Cool colleagues :)

Interview process

Behavioral Dialogue with Talent Acquisition Team (30m)
Live Coding: Evaluating Coding Skills (90m)
Tech Dialogue: Computer Science Fundamentals (2 hours)
Executive Dialogue (optional - L3+): Leadership and Power Skills (30m)

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest testing trends. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and testing practises as well as core concepts of your primary language (e.g. Javascript or Python). We will also try to tackle some real-world testing problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.

Requirements

Industry experience in software testing
Strong CS background
Strong skills in one of Javascript, Python, Ruby, Groovy
Good knowledge of at least one testing framework (cypress.io, webdriverIO, playwright)
Knowing your way around databases
Testing mindset and an eye for clean code
Really comfortable with Git
Excellent communication in English
BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
Bonus: experience with Docker / Kubernetes
Bonus: knowing your way around the *nix shell
Bonus: experience with CI Solutions (Jenkins, Github Actions, etc)

Benefits

Blueground Stock Option Plan
Flexible paid time off
Group Health Insurance program
Enhanced parental leave
Dynamic working environment with talented people
Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program

Job Description

Our client is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through their broad experience and deep expertise they advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions. They provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through their advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services.

As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, they help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. They are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.

Your responsibilities

The energy transition is accelerating, and digitalization will be a key driver for the whole energy industry. Our client is building a new development team to focus on the digital transformation of our technical tools and processes and the creation of reusable python code modules that can be utilised through digital platforms and cloud services (developed on our Veracity Platform in Azure) as part of a broad digital ecosystem This means developing new tools and models from engineering principles as well as recoding existing technical calculation tools that may have been developed in Matlab, Excel/VBA or similar.

We are looking for strong Python developers with a technical/engineering background that can work with their engineers and consultants across the globe to help drive the digitalization.

▪ The candidate will be responsible for the development of professional python software models and tools to provide engineering calculations and technical data analytics for a wide range of applications within the energy value chain.

▪ Working closely with client’s engineers and consultants to develop new models and calculation tools as well as the recoding and updating of existing tools from other platforms.

▪ As part of our core python development team, the candidate will be a “Python champion” within the organization, supporting the professionalization and development of our broad Python user base.

Our requirements

Essential skills:

▪ Strong experience (3 years +) of developing in Python for engineering or industrial data analysis applications. Able to carry out coding task independently and as part of a team

▪ Able to specify and write unit tests and integration tests to verify the integrity of the software you develop

▪ Familiarity with Agile software development, code management, build and release pipelines with Azure DevOps or similar solutions

▪ Experience with Jupiter Notebooks is desirable

▪ Experience with API development, Relational Databases, Azure technologies, web application development in C#.NET would be beneficial

Other:

▪ Test-Driven Development

▪ Implementing automated deployment scripts in YAML for Microsoft DevOps environment

▪ Developing and consuming RESTful API services

▪ Experience with processing data using Spark (PySpark)

▪ Agile development methodology such as Scrum

Benefits

▪ Attractive salary referring to your skills and experience

▪ For contractors: eligibility for additional 23 days

▪ Remote work during Covid-19 pandemic and home office option in the future ()

▪ Joining the company that is providing exceptional services for the biggest, international customers with recognizable worldwide brands

▪ Private medical healthcare

▪ MultisportCard

▪ Life insurance

▪ Personal event bonus (i.e.,wedding, childbirth, graduation)

▪ Internal referral program

As a Devops Engineer in the Blockchain protocol team, you will be involved in a number of technically challenging problems, overseeing design and coding for features. We are solving issues that have no existing solutions and require innovative ideas.

This position will focus on blockchain related functions alongside common functions in a microservices architecture. You will have the chance to be involved in every aspect of the development process, from brainstorming the next great product innovation, performance optimizations to tweaking documentations right before launch.

Build secure and reliable cloud infrastructure to monitor, detect and mitigate performance and security issues, with a focus on blockchain related systems

Automate and streamline operations and processes
Stay up to date and follow on cosmos-sdk chain best practices
Maintain open-source blockchain ecosystem repos
Work closely with the blockchain engineers to influence decision making and implementation efforts

3+ years of work experience in devops / SRE / infratructure
Knowledge of cryptography and security best practices

Benefits

What you can expect from us?

We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech.

Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve.
The possibilities are limitless and depend on you.
You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team.
You will get to have involvement in developing a brand new product from scratch alongside with a talented team.

Aiven strives to be the world’s leading cloud data platform - simply by making developer’s lives better. We are a cast of over 500 ‘Crabs’ with a passion for open-source and a cutting edge tech stack. We take ownership of the problems we solve and act with courage. Openness is our beating heart.

It takes an uncommon person to contribute to the common good. Would you like to join our Cast where everyone at every level works side-by-side on making developers’ lives better, and letting them build what matters most?

Aiven in a crabshell:

Our platform delivers reliable and secure data ops
Global service footprint & support organization
Security is central to us
500+ customers in 60+ countries
$420M in VC funding
Our Burrow in Helsinki and hubs in Berlin, Boston, Paris, Singapore, Sydney, Toronto and Tokyo, remote team members employees from all over the world.

We value and celebrate the diversity of our people. We strive every day to build an inclusive workplace where all of us can thrive. We have a journey ahead of us, and are committed to taking that journey towards being a more diverse and inclusive company.

Come and read more about us at https://aiven.io/blog/what-is-aiven.

The Role:

We are looking for a backend engineer to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best open source technologies into frustration-free cloud services. You’ll be part of a team working on the Aiven cloud platform, improving its scalability and reliability, implementing new features as well as extending our product portfolio of open source data technologies.

Our philosophy is to automate everything and to avoid repetitive manual work in everything we do. Our own backend systems are mostly implemented in Python with bits of Java, Go and C. We offer and operate a number of complex open source databases such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, ClickHouse and Apache Cassandra and open source data technologies such as Apache Kafka and Apache Flink.

What You'll Do:

Writing high quality, maintainable code and releasing quality features
Performing peer reviews and participating in technical discussions both at the team level and among the product development engineering domain
Contributing to technical planning and backlog management
Helping investigate and resolve customer issues

What We're Looking For:

Must-have:

Excellent development skills, preferably in Python
Ability to write good automated tests
Experience on using Linux in development
Fluency in English, verbal and written

Nice to have:

Hands-on experience with some of the following systems: Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Apache Cassandra, ClickHouse, Elasticsearch/OpenSearch
Good understanding of security (software, networking)
Distributed systems knowledge
Experience and/or interest in infrastructure as code

Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up perfectly – we still encourage you to apply. We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.

Our Offer

If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.

We invest in you

Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.
Dreaming of flexible work arrangements? Look no further. Work in one of our hubs, fully remote, or anything in between.
Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.
Step up your career game with real employer support (use one of our learning platforms, annual learning budget, and more).
Get holistic wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.

Make a difference at Aiven

Contribute to open source projects that you find meaningful outside of work - and get paid for it! Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.
Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.
Support or mentor earlier stage startups through our Cluster Startup program.
Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.

What else?

We care about your learning: We provide beginners and advanced German lessons to help you settle in to your new environment
Your wellbeing matters: we provide professional massage at the office as well as health and fitness benefits through Urban Sport Club membership
Love breakfast? So do we! Join us at our monthly team breakfast
Know someone who would be the perfect fit for Aiven? You can benefit from our referral bonus programme as soon as you join.

Amazing! What’s next?

If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV, and we’ll get in touch!

iTech Media is a high growth marketing and product development company which started with a simple mission: to help people make smart choices online. We build digital products that inform and entertain a global audience across the most competitive comparison markets in the world: iGaming, Sports Betting, Personal Finance, and we’re expanding into new verticals.
We bring to life a network of over 150 products across 50+ countries, serving 130,000,000 users annually. Founded in 2015, iTech remains bootstrapped, and is scaling up rapidly with a proudly people-first culture. We’ve got big ambitions for the future, continuing to help the world’s top brands to grow their brands, and we need talented people who share our ambition to join us for the next, most exciting part of our journey.
Why we need you:
You will join our SRE team, which work closely with all Engineers within the company to ensure they are providing the best support and resources to everyone sothey can easily and reliably select and use the most optimal platforms for each use case.
Together as a team you will support, learn and drive at some point technically interesting migration projects from new acquisitions to existing products to ensure high availability, cost efficiency, monitoring and performance across the board. In this role you will be expected to work with other engineers to improve and evolve the company’s CI/CD capabilities, driving improvements in efficiency, performance, and reliability.
This role will give you the opportunity to develop and work with an epic pool of talented engineers that are continuously improving our engineering ways of working. We build and maintain platform, we are automation obsessed as well as we like improving performance.
Not only that, but we also follow an application E2E from the way it gets deployed to how it gets monitored and put on our underlying centralized infrastructure.
Tools we use: GitHub, Docker, AWS (EKS, EC2, Cloudwatch, ECR, ECS and so on), Terraform, Helm, K8S, Jenkins, Linux, Cloudflare, Prometheus.
What you’ll be doing:
Contribute to SRE activities from cloud strategy to day-to-day operations.
Be involved in improving availability and report across globally distributed websites.
Seek for growth in capabilities for improving and automating infrastructure operations.
Support Software Engineers with CI/CD and DevOps topics.
Be there for your colleagues and get your hands dirty together.
Support, learn, drive both technically & logistics of interesting migration projects from new acquisitions to existing product to ensure high availability, cost efficiency, monitoring and performance across the board.
You’ll have:
Proficiency with Linux operation system (admin or advanced user experience).
Solid AWS experience and knowledge (including navigation, use and consume most common services, troubleshooting, architecting is nice to have).
Experience with CI/CD toolings and pipelines.
Knowledge of DevOps culture combined to a DevOps mindset.
Skill in any automation tools.
K8s hands-on experience
Cloud migration experience is a plus.
TechLead/People manager experience/aspiration is a plus.
Our Process:
Here at iTech Media we’re real believers in an interview being a two-way process, this is as much about you finding out everything you need to know about us as well as getting to know you. To help you understand what the process will involve:
Initial Conversation with a member of the Talent Team – approx. 30 mins
1st Stage Interview with SRE team members – 45 mins
Take Home Test (we’ll email you some details)
2nd Stage Interview (Task) with Senior Engineering Manager, Teach Lead or Site Reliability Engineer – 60 mins
All the interview stages are held over Zoom. If you have a disability, a learning difficulty as dyslexia, a medical condition or other individual need for an adjustment to our process; and you believe this may affect your performance in selection, we’ll be happy to make reasonable adjustments to our processes for you. Please let us know in good time, so that we can support you to perform at your best.
What we can do for you:
Flexible working hours – “work your way”
26 days holiday, regardless of tenure, plus we close over end of year holiday period. You also get two days for your birthday and a life event, and two paid volunteering days a year.
Private healthcare including dental, wellbeing and talking therapy
Annual training budget of €1,000, plus regular training days to support your growth and development
Eligibility for our discretionary bonus scheme
Company-wide share option scheme
Pension contribution matched up to 4%
Life insurance cover up to 300,000PLN

We’re creating an unrivalled opportunity for our teams to grow and belong, and as we scale, we know we need the most talented people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives and skills. If you’re good at what you do, come and join us. The more inclusive we are, the more epic experiences we can create for our communities.

Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do
Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

#Stack

At Jua you will go on a mission to unriddle the world's atmosphere by using the latest deep learning and satellite technology to build tools for monitoring and forecasting. Renewable energy, precision agriculture, autonomous transport and parametric insurance will deliver on their potential only because of the work you do.
Having raised millions in venture capital (at a sensible valuation), our first objective will be to provide businesses and countries with several orders of magnitude better and faster weather forecasts.
You will be surrounded by people who have built several successful companies before and worked on exciting technologies used by hundreds of millions of people and thousands of businesses.
You will contribute to our culture of an extremely high level of ambition, direct and friendly communication, rapid iteration and a healthy dose of humbleness. The team is completely remote with hubs currently in Zurich and Berlin.
We offer exciting challenges, creative freedom, an extremely smart and cheerful team, fair compensation and generous shares in the company (and some other perks you would normally expect).

We are bridge builders and bring together the best in machine learning, physics, aerospace, data processing and UX design. Together, we will build one of the key components to enable a world worth living in at a time of changing climate and increasing extreme events.

What We Are Looking For

For this position we are looking for an experienced data engineer with hands-on experience in building and optimizing ETL pipelines in the cloud. If you enjoy finding bottlenecks in data processing, bringing in ideas for optimization, handling petabytes of data to speed up climate research and you are tempted to use your skills to put our systems on steroids - get in touch!

As Senior Geospatial Data Engineer, you will be responsible for our ETL pipelines and developing a scalable data infrastructure in the cloud. As a link between our data suppliers (IoT data, vehicle data, satellite data) and our weather modeling you have a great deal of creative freedom and set up our data warehouse right from the start. If you enjoy working with very large amounts of data, love to tinker and want to be part of the next generation of climate & weather forecasts - then you've come to the right place.

Responsibilities And Tasks
Developing and improving scalable ETL pipelines in the cloud
Loading, processing, normalizing and providing various data types from point data such as sensor measurements to raster data such as satellite or radar
Developing and improving an extensible data warehouse as the heart for weather modeling
Ensuring of Performance, robustness and high availability
Development of interfaces for the exchange of data from a wide variety of applications
Testing, validating, visualizing and documenting new approaches and their performance

Need-to-have
M.Sc., and preferably a PhD in computer science, GIS or equivalent experience in data engineering
at least 5 years of professional experience in the field of data engineering
You have already set up scalable ETL pipelines, know the common database systems and have experience with common ETL libraries
Experience with distributed systems and various cloud providers
You are proficient in Python, as well as in a compiled language (C/C++, Java, Julia or Go)
You can develop solutions independently based on targets and have experience with agile work
Experience with GIS-based data such as satellite, radar or radiosondes
Experience in handling large amounts of data (>1TB)
You have experience and interest in the development of the idea, from a prototype to the finished product
You appreciate the values of an open feedback culture and transparency

Nice-to-have
You are familiar with the Google Cloud Platform & AWS ecosystem
You have already had touchpoints in weather & climate science
Extensive geographical knowledge
You are attracted to a growing environment, great opportunities and a lot of creative freedom

Only EMEA-based candidates will be considered at this stage.

LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a Conversational AI company creating digital experiences that are Curiously Human. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.

You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself.

Overview

The LivePerson SRE team is looking for DevOps Engineer to join our Observability Engineering team. We are looking to provide world-class and easy-to-use observability tools for our engineering and product teams. We believe that by partnering with our engineering and product teams, we can help select, build out, and release observability tooling.

You Will
Help drive the selection, testing, implementation, and rollout of new observability tooling.
Maintain existing observability infrastructure, ensuring performance, availability, and stability goals are met.
Partner with engineering and product teams to understand their current observability challenges and provide solutions.
Deploy changes to observability infrastructure leveraging IaC and configuration management tooling.
Develop and extend in-house built observability tooling.
Contribute to our 24/7 on-call rotation for observability infrastructure.
Document observability golden paths for teams to quickly adopt and maximize usage of existing monitoring tools.
You Have
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline, or in place of a 4-year degree, equivalent engineering work experience.
3+ years of experience in a DevOps or Software Engineering role.
3+ years of experience with software observability tooling
2+ years of experience in one or more programming languages
Experience with 3 or more of the following types of observability tooling: logging, metrics, events, alerts, debugging, and tracing.
Experience managing infrastructure in a hybrid cloud (on-prem & public cloud) is preferred.
Experience with Go or Node.JS is preferred.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform is a plus.
Benefits
Health: medical, dental, and vision
Time away: 28 vacation days
Development: Native AI learning
Additional: Food Vouchers, monthly phone and internet allowance.
Why You'll Love Working Here

Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces.

Belonging At LivePerson

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world 🌎

We’re looking for Backend Engineers that want to change the world. If you like to work at a steady pace with no surprises, keep scrolling. If you want your work to change the global financial landscape, you might be just who we’re looking for. We have a minimalist approach to using external frameworks, with emphasis on maintainability and fast turnaround with TDD, DDD and Continuous Integration & Delivery. Sound like your speed? Let’s chat 👇

Our technology stack:
Java 17
GCP
Kubernetes
Docker
PostgreSQL
Redis
Spock
SparkJava
JOOQ and TDD approach

What You’ll Be Doing
Building mobile APIs
Developing micro services to evolve our architecture
Perfecting a number of systems that our business depend on, like risk management, fraud detection, payment processing for example
Focusing mostly on greenfield development and improvement of existing systems

What You'll Need
Fluency with Java
3+ years of experience in back-end development
At least a bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Maths/Physics/similar
Quick learner attitude with an ambitious and results driven personality
Ability to work well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication and organisational skills
Fluent English

Nice to have
Experience with Kotlin and Scala
Experience within Finance
Experience within a start-up or scale-up
Experience within a product focussed environment

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Job Details

What You Will Do

Is Azure your top environment? Are you delivering PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions? Join our international team, and support Azure Data Lake now and Azure Snowflake in the future!

Our Benefits

At Johnson Controls you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting projects in today’s market. Our hardworking people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, results-oriented, hardworking and above all fun.

We are looking for a Data Engineer responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure and systems that enable the collection, storage, and analysis of large sets of data. Experience with data governance and data security best practices.

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot and debug complex systems.

Excellent communication skills, as Data Engineers often need to work closely with other teams and stakeholders.

Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and experience working in a collaborative, cross-functional environment.

Having experience with Machine Learning or Data Science is a plus but not mandatory for the role of Data Engineer.

Glue es una empresa atípica, y lo es porque el equipo está en el centro de todo. Sacar lo mejor de cada uno y ayudar a que todos exploten su potencial al máximo es seguramente una de las cosas que mejor hemos hecho. Esta es la esencia de Glue Digital y lo que nos permite, aun siendo pequeños, ayudar a titanes en sus proyectos más relevantes. Actualmente estamos buscando un dev full stack Senior para integrarse en uno de nuestros mejores proyectos.

Responsabilidades:

Escribirás, revisarás y mantendrás código principalmente en lenguajes JS y JAVA, con bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales, arquitecturas hexagonales y grandes volúmenes de datos.
Trabajarás con el equipo de diseño para construir nuevos productos y nuevas funcionalidades.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Salario competitivo + Incentivos + Shares de las startups que ayudamos a construir.
Trabaja desde donde quieras, Glue Digital es Full Remote.
Seguro médico opcional.
Posibilidad de asistir a eventos internacionales 4YFN, MWC Americas, Websummit, Rise...
Buen ambiente de trabajo, buenas herramientas, poca deuda técnica y proyectos interesantes.
Trabajarás con buenxs diseñadorxs, arquitectxs, developers y project managers, en algunos de los mejores proyectos de algunas de las compañías más grandes del mundo.
Trabajarás en algunos de los topics tecnológicos mas interesantes (Big and Small, Data, PWAs, DLTs, Orquestaciones de Docker y Kubernetes...)
Glue Digital es una empresa naturalmente inclusiva, nos gusta el talento diverso y apoyamos la diversidad en (casi) todas sus formas. Intentamos que sea un lugar donde todo el mundo sea como quiere ser y donde convertise en la mejor version de unx mismx.
Glue tiene una rotación mínima, de las más bajas del sector, esto es por la enorme flexibilidad del entorno, nos adecuamos a tu vida y te dejamos desarrollarla como tú quieras, sin estupideces, puedes trabajar con el equipo que quieras, desde donde quieras y en casi el horario que quieras, solo tienes que hacerlo bien.

Qué pedimos

Al menos 4 años de experiencia desarrollando aplicaciones web.
Experiencia trabajando con frameworks Javascript preferiblemente React (con Redux, Hooks...).
Experiencia con Java Spring Boot.
Experiencia trabajando con bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales.
Experiencia trabajando con GIT, control de versiones, pruebas y Lints, así como otras herramientas de análisis de código.
Interés en el testing, TDD, arquitectura hexagonal y código limpio.
También valoraremos la buena actitud hacia el trabajo y el buen trato. Lo más importante en Glue es el equipo, mantenerlo sano y equilibrado es un trabajo diario del que también formarás parte.
Todo el equipo valorará que te esfuerces por en el trato con los demás, las relaciones son muy importantes, si además de todo lo demás eres unx tipx divertidx pues mejor que mejor.

Mirai es una fintech. Nuestro conocimiento funcional del sector financiero sumado a una amplia experiencia en proyectos tecnológicos nos permite dar soluciones innovadoras a diferentes retos de negocio.
De la mano de un profundo conocimiento del sector y rodeados de un equipo enfocado a la innovación y la excelencia técnica, nació nuestro producto MAT– Mirai ALM Tool – que es una solución nativa en cloud para la gestión de riesgos financieros, concretamente del riesgo estructural de balance o ALM.
Actualmente MAT está implantado y en pleno rendimiento en diferentes clientes a nivel nacional e internacional, y nos encontramos en fase de expansión.
Somos un equipo multidisciplinar especializado tanto en el sector financiero como en todas las capas de un producto digital [diseño, front-end, back-end, data science, big data e infraestructura]. Si algo nos caracteriza como equipo, es la orientación a la calidad y la mejora continua, por eso MAT está en constante desarrollo adaptándolo y actualizándolo a las últimas tecnologías, así como desarrollando múltiples funcionalidades para dar un servicio cada vez más especializado y de mayor calidad a cada uno de nuestros clientes.
Queremos incorporar una persona proactiva con responsabilidades cross a todos los equipos. Punto de encuentro para las mejoras de seguridad y vulnerabilidades, tanto descubiertas por agentes externos como desde sus labores de pentesting.

¿Qué buscamos?

Purple team!
Buenas prácticas de securización de entornos cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Buenas prácticas de desarrollo (OWASP).
Buenas prácticas en desarrollo de software con GIT (gitflow, github-flow, PR, etc).
Conocimientos de pentesting.
Conocimientos en seguridad de contenedores (Docker, Kubernetes, RBAC, ABAC).
Conocimientos de compliance: políticas, legislación y auditoría de seguridad.
Plus: Conocimientos de Zero-Trust.
Plus: JVM y seguridad en Java.
Plus: CKS.
Plus: Supply chain security.

¿Qué vas a hacer?

Se trata de un rol transversal dentro de los equipos, con responsabilidades tanto en entorno Cloud como a nivel global.

Entorno Cloud:

Conocer las herramientas de análisis y auditoría de los principales proveedores cloud (AWS mínimo).
Pentesting a nivel código e infraestructura.
Análisis de la infraestructura y código para mejorar la seguridad.
White box testing.
Análisis y clasificación de alertas de seguridad.
Aplicación de cambios relativos a seguridad dentro de AWS (IAM/SSO/etc).
Reportar a los distintos equipos las vulnerabilidades descubiertas.
Coordinar con el management los tiempos de resolución de vulnerabilidades.

Entorno Global:

Promocionar las buenas prácticas de seguridad en los equipos.
Verificar el compliance: políticas, legislación y auditoría de seguridad.
Administración de las distintas herramientas de seguridad dentro de la compañía.
Apoyo ante incidentes de seguridad, planes de contingencia.

¿Por qué Mirai?

Contrato indefinido, ¡buscamos relaciones a largo plazo!
Crecimiento personal y profesional, estamos constantemente actualizándonos y enfrentándonos a nuevos retos.
Creemos e impulsamos la innovación y la excelencia técnica.
Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
“Work from anywhere” Tú decides desde donde trabajas: 100% remote, 50%, etc.
Cursos de inglés, certificaciones punteras y formación a medida.
Retribución flexible con COBEE (transporte, restaurantes y guardería).
Seguro médico y dental 100% financiado por la empresa. Well-being package.
Hasta 29 días de vacaciones al año.
Salario competitivo.

Mirai ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acepta solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad y no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación sexual o Identidad de género, o cualquier otra base según lo protegido por la ley vigente.

¡Hola! Soy Víctor, cofundador de Planet 🌍, la única plataforma de automatización y gestión de precios para Shopify en español. Actualmente contamos con más de 500 clientes, con presencia en ¡+65 países diferentes!

Por ello, estamos ampliando nuestro equipo con un programador Front-end para el desarrollo de nuevas funcionalidades para nuestra plataforma. 💻🤙🏻

Qué ofrecemos:
Una oportunidad de escapar de los desarrollos monolíticos. Cada mes lanzamos una funcionalidad nueva, dando pie a progresar con tus conocimientos de desarrollo, y evitar la monotonía de hacer las mismas tareas una y otra vez.
Una organización horizontal donde se tienen en cuenta las diversas opiniones e ideas a la hora de tomar decisiones.
Un entorno de trabajo distendido al máximo. Nos consideramos una familia, y basamos nuestra cultura en la confianza y la cercanía 😊.
El mejor sitio para crecer. Avanzamos rápido, experimentando y aprendiendo juntos.
Horario flexible elegido por la persona. Trabajo por sprints, basado en metodología Scrum.
Salario: 23-27k€ anuales.

Qué puedes esperar de tus primeros meses en Planet:
El primer mes te pondrás a punto para poder desarrollar: aprenderás a usar nuestra plataforma y conocerás sus puntos fuertes y mejorables, prepararás tu entorno de desarrollo y aprenderás a usar las herramientas que tenemos en Front. Podrás ver cómo nos coordinamos e incluso haber colaborado en alguna tarea de desarrollo menor.
En el segundo mes habrás desplegado cambios menores en nuestro sistema de diseño y nuestras extensiones de Shopify con la ayuda de tu mentor.
En el tercer mes te habrás enfrentado a una tarea de desarrollo dentro de nuestra plataforma y para las extensiones de Shopify. Será un mes donde experimentarás a fondo con los stacks de cada entorno.
Al cabo de seis meses esperamos que ya sepas qué se puede y no se puede hacer con la API de Shopify, que participes en el diseño de nuevos addons y que puedas afrontar nuevos desarrollos en la plataforma (siempre con la ayuda de tus compañeros :)).
El objetivo final es que con el tiempo lideres el desarrollos de addons para la sección de automatizaciones, proponiendo soluciones que se adapten a los requisitos y limitaciones de Shopify.

Requisitos técnicos:
Conocimientos demostrables en el desarrollo con Angular o dos años de experiencia laboral en desarrollo web.
El prototipado se desarrolla en Figma y se maqueta en HTML5 y SCSS. Disponemos de una línea de diseño para simplificar este proceso.
Conocimientos básicos de patrones de diseño e interés por desarrollar código que sea fácil de mantener.
La mayor parte de los desarrollos parten de cero, por lo que priman las buenas prácticas. Esto permite ir actualizando las versiones sobre una base sólida y robusta para todo el equipo.
Experiencia con Git.
Conocimientos básicos de MongoDB.
MongoDB es nuestro motor de BBDD principal por lo que cualquier funcionalidad que desarrolles pasará por comunicarte con ella.
Para pruebas, debbuging e incidencias será necesario consultar directamente a la base de datos, por lo que, si tienes experiencia previa te resultará de gran ayuda.
No es necesario conocer todas las tecnologías de nuestro stack, pero sí especial interés por aprender y trabajar con ellas. En el día a día, desarrollarás en Angular@14, pero entrarás en contacto con nuestra infraestructura de AWS, sistema de logs y demás tecnologías.

También, es deseable:
Nos gustan las personas resolutivas, que no tengan miedo a enfrentarse a nuevas situaciones y a trabajar desde la terminal.
El interés por explorar todos los campos y tecnologías es algo esencial; siempre estamos buscando cómo optimizar nuestros procesos, aunque implique integrarnos con otras plataformas o usar otras librerías.
El inglés es algo esencial. Desarrollarás funcionalidad para una plataforma que se usa por todo el mundo; por lo que ayudar en la internacionalización de los textos y tener en cuenta el formateo de números y moneda es parte del día a día.

wethod è una Single Page Application che aiuta le persone a collaborare in modo intelligente sui progetti più disparati.
Proponiamo una nuova visione di gestione aziendale grazie ad un software sviluppato internamente in H-FARM.
Siamo un team indipendente e promuoviamo un nuovo approccio al management: distribuito, condiviso e adatto ai tempi moderni. Affianchiamo agenzie creative, studi di architettura e d'ingegneria, software house, società di consulenza e aziende orientate a progetti nell’adozione dell’approccio organizzativo più adatto a loro, applicando un nuovo metodo che sceglie le regole in base al contesto in cui opera.

Chi cerchiamo:
Con l’obiettivo di crescere e migliorare, stiamo cercando un nuovo Full Stack Developer per il nostro team dev; sei la figura ideale se hai un’esperienza pregressa nel settore e una ottima conoscenza del funzionamento di una web app.
Ti occuperai della manutenzione e dell’evolutiva della nostra applicazione in sinergia con il nostro grandioso team Dev!
Skill richieste:
Princìpi di funzionamento di una Web App
HTML
JavaScript
React
CSS
PHP
Symfony (preferibile) o Laravel
PostgreSQL (preferibile) o SQL
Skill plus:
Doctrine
AWS
Docker
Redux
Ovviamente non ti stiamo chiedendo di fare volontariato: la RAL verrà stabilita in base al tuo livello di esperienza e al grado di autonomia/supporto che potrai offrire al resto del team - vuoi un’idea di massima? Tra i 25.000 e i 40.000€ annui in base alle tue competenze.

Il nostro team non vede l’ora di crescere, e per questo stiamo cercando una persona che sia disponibile da subito.

Siamo per un'altissima flessibilità di spostamento, ovvero il nostro team lavora e si coordina senza problemi da remoto, ma ogni volta che serve ci fa piacere incontrarci nel campus di H-FARM a Roncade.

Ora, se sei arrivato fin qui e credi essere la persona giusta manda la tua candidatura! Ti aspettiamo.

⚡Oportunidad única⚡

En ILERWORK nos encontramos en busca de un Analista Programador AS/400 para un gran proyecto del sector de la Banca. Si estas buscando estabilidad laboral y un entorno internacional para crecer profesionalmente, no busques mas!

REQUISITOS:
· Amplia experiencia en desarrollo en entorno AS/400, Cobol IBM zOS y DB2.
· Disponibilidad para realizar guardias en remoto.
· Inglés intermedio, B2.

VALORABLE:
· Experiencia en Banca.

UBICACIÓN: Teletrabajo 100%. Posibilidad de asistir puntualmente a las oficinas del cliente en Boadilla del Monte. Imprescindible residencia en la Comunidad de Madrid

Que se ofrece:

Salario muy competitivo
Oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente
Gran proyecto
Estabilidad laboral

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Primefaces
BBDD SQL

Wildfly

Se valorará muy positivamente aquellos perfiles con experiencia DevOps (Azure DevOps, AWS Developer tools, Jenkins), base de datos NOSQL (ElasticSearch, MongoDB, CosmosDB, DynamoDB).

Plan de carrera

Formación retribuida

Salario: 35.000 € / 45.000 €

We seek an Account(Sales) Manage for a SaaS product in the SEO niche.

The daily routine will include the following:
- Introducing new clients to our products.
- Checking your accounts' performance.
- Providing recommendations to your clients.

What we expect from you:
- Extrovert personality
- Fluent in English
- Be proficient in business communications
- Understand the principles of SEO
- Have a comfortable and silent environment for work
- Fast internet and professional headset for calls

The position is entirely remote and doesn't have a strict schedule.
We have many clients from Asia, so if you are somewhere in America, please be ready to work evening hours.

We are a startup based in Madrid, and the top digital platform for online parking in Europe. We book customers their parking space in the city center, at airports and at train stations, and we do it at an unbeatable price with discounts that reach up to 70% off the original retail price. We also allow our clients to pay the parking meter in Barcelona and Madrid, and soon in many other European cities. We currently have more than 1 million users and we operate in 8 countries and more than 240 cities.

Our mission is not only to digitize the world of parking, but also to offer everyone at Parclick an incredible opportunity to work and learn at a proper start-up with brilliant colleagues and continuous challenges.

We are looking for a B2B Business Developer Assistant to join our Partnership team. The B2B and Partnership department together with the trade marketing department focuses its efforts on helping those companies willing to add value to their products or services by reselling our products. The channel that gives us the highest satisfaction is certainly B2B and B2B2C, and we achieve it through various technological solutions.
Our most faithful partners are companies operating in the tourism and hotel sectors. But that's not all. Opportunities arise in the market every day, and our job is to analyze and value them on the basis of an opportunity-cost approach. The Partnership department at Parclick will help partners achieve their business goals and, at the same time position our products on the market, making Parclick the most successful brand in its sector.

Responsibilities

Lead, structure and execute projects with a high level of ownership and freedom with a strong focus on success.
Managing existent partners portfolio in Parclick’s B2B markets of action through customer care (phone calls, email or in person if needed).
Identify and build long lasting relationships with strategic partners.
Developing existing and new distribution channels.
Analyze business opportunities and risks, conducting market researches and lead qualification/calling.
Prospecting new business opportunities/partners to grow in the events area.
Independently managing partners from lead generation to contract signature.
Prospect new possible partners or business segments by actively looking for new opportunities.
Participating in events and fairs as a Parclick Ambassador.
Coordinate, manage and solve partners issues.
Content generation.

Qualifications
We’re looking for a candidate with a positive and proactive attitude.
You have the capacity to work independently although always surrounded by your colleagues.
2 or more years of sales experience.
Fluent Spanish speaker. Good working knowledge of Spanish and English.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Outstanding communication, negotiation and influencing skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and confidence is approaching and discussing solutions and products with strangers.
Able to multitask.
Ability to work to targets and KPI’s and self-monitor own performance.
Analytical and strategic planning skills.
International and multicultural perspective.
Entrepreneurial mindset.
Availability to travel.

We highly Value
French and/or Italian as a second language will be highly valued.
Previous experiences in a b2b environment prospecting and/or managing business accounts.
Previous experience with a CRM.
Previous experience in marketing and designing tools.
Knowledge of the parking and tourism industry.
Ability to get to know people, build and maintain meaningful professional relationships.
A results-oriented approach to work.
This job is 100% remote but it will be highly valued if you are based in Barcelona or Madrid.

We offer:
Flexible schedule.
Competitive salary based on experience and a bonus based on results.
Remote work.
The chance to work in a motivating and open environment with talented colleagues that you can learn a lot from.
5 days available to attend training and seminars of your choice in the company.
Company culture based on open communication— everybody has the chance to contribute and take part in the conversation.
25 Days of paid vacation.

If you think you are a good match for this position and our company, send us your application now! We look forward to hearing from you. We will get back to you as soon as possible with extra details and questions. Further information will be addressed in an interview.

job_title: Azure Data Engineer - 6 weeks vacation / year
description:
We are looking for one passionate Azure Data Consultant to join our Spanish team.

About us:
MDW (My Data Works) is a consulting company founded by passionate about the fields of data and cloud. It has offices in Geneva (Switzerland) and Madrid (Spain). We specialize in Data , Artificial Intelligence, Business Intelligence and Business applications. MDW was named "Global Microsoft Finalist 2022: Power BI", "Swiss Microsoft Partner Of The Year 2022: Power Platform", "Swiss Microsoft Partner Of The Year 2021: Analytics & AI".

What we offer:
· 6 weeks of vacation per year!
· A competitive salary based on your skills
· A personalized career plan
· Remote working
· Restaurant vouchers on top of your salary
The role:
You will be responsible for developing and run end-to-end Data Platform and/or BI solutions.
Innovation is present in our DNA, we love disruptive projects, new technologies, and beta previews. If you are a data-passioned person, at MDW you will find the technical challenges you want to face.
We are a company that cultivates singularity and helps you make the most of your proactivity and creativity.
The mission:
· Implementation Data Platform, BI, and Analytics solutions
· Monitor developments (reports, feeds, scripts) or carry out them
· Participate in the creation/evolution of solutions
· Ensure a technological watch in the fields of Data and BI
· Mastering the technical architecture of BI environments (Senior)
· Manage different deployment projects (Senior, Specialist)
Your profile:
· Experience in data and BI projects
· Experience using Azure Data Platform
· Good organizational and time-management skills
· Rigorous, result- and customer-oriented
· Ability to manage priorities and address multiple requests in parallel
· Ability to handle requests and resolve them independently or as part of a team
Your skills:
· Knowledge and experience in BI data model modeling
· Experience working on end-to-end data projects (full stack)
· Knowledge of Microsoft Azure technologies (Data Factory, Synapse) and/or Power BI
· Knowledge of data processing techniques (transformation, profiling, visualization)
· Knowledge of scripting (T-SQL, Powershell)
· Language: Spanish, English

Good to have:
· Experience with Python
· Experience in Big Data environments
· Experience with DevOps
· Azure certifications
· Experience working on Agile environment
Employment Type
Full-time

We're looking for a new member to join the team and help accelerate our client's growth.

Responsibilities
First, you'll learn.
We'll teach you everything you (still) need to know about our clients, their needs, the media industry, and online marketing. Once you're ready, you'll own tasks, and responsibilities split into 3 main pillars:

Research: Support the team in finding the best solution for the clients.
Execution: Manage & optimize media campaigns.
Reporting: Collect & present the performance data of your campaigns.

What will your day look like? That depends on you, your clients, and your team members. In the beginning, you'll spend more time with your colleagues during the intensive onboarding period. Later, it'll get a lot more flexible.

Qualifications
Candidates with the highest chances of being accepted will have to match all of the following conditions:
At least 2 years of experience running programmatic campaigns (DV360, Amazon DSP, Active Agent, adform, Xandr, The Trade Desk, etc.)
Be fluent in German and English (Verbal and written)
Must be good at solving problems and helping others solve theirs.
Have confidence and belief that there's always a better way of doing things
Be the best teammate one could hope to have.

If you believe you'd make a good candidate, we'd like to hear from you and understand why. Please submit a 3-5 min introduction video to the following email: iwanttowork@indiead.tech

For more information about working@IndieAd, visit out website: https://www.indiead.tech/open-positions
