What is it like to be a software developer at InnovationCast?

We are looking for software developers based in Portugal, interested in growing with our company, willing to learn and expand their knowledge and make a dent in the universe.

As a software developer you will:

Write pragmatic, performant, and testable code
Develop and maintain the code for an ever-evolving product that helps companies innovate
Work with the product owner to elicit requirements
Field second level support for customers, diagnose bugs or issues
Step up to resolve issues, large and small
Collaborate with colleagues during product brainstorms, technical design discussions and code reviews
Propose and implement solutions for customer requests and issues

You will contribute to the architecture of the product, participating in feature and implementation discussions. You will not be just another cog in the machine, but rather a crucial part of a company where its software product is key and valued by leading customer brands (don’t take it from us, read the testimonials on our homepage!).

We do code reviews to help build both the software and the team. Automated tests help in defining behaviours and fixing bugs, and getting the bugs to stay fixed.

Here’s what we’ll expect from you as a .Net Backend Developer

Backend developers design the services in use by both internal and external customers.
You need to be proficient in modelling scenarios and entities required for use cases, including weighing trade-offs between different implementations and approaches.

Developers also need to consider non-functional requirements during development. Performance needs to be considered whenever designing and implementing features, and those services must also be secure against attackers.

Qualifications

Advanced web development using ASP.NET MVC, .NET Core or ServiceStack
C#
At least 2 years building and maintaining backend services for web applications
Experience with document and relational databases
Experience with source control

Experience that can set you apart from other candidates

We use the following stack and tools, so direct experience with these is valuable

Git
RavenDB
PostgreSQL
ServiceStack
Redis
Powershell

Experience with the following practices is also a plus:

OWASP secure coding practices
Test-driven development

Base qualifications
Learning mindset and motivation to further develop your skills
Love to ship features that make a difference. We move fast!
Willingness to learn new technologies
Experience collaborating with product/design to build polished user-facing products
Communicate clearly in written English
Experience developing web applications (preferably >2 years, but competency is what we are looking for)
Experience developing a SaaS Product is a plus

Pay range

35k€-55k€ gross anual

Benefits
Opportunity to work in a fast-growing, VC-backed, award-winning, and ambitious startup
Work on an innovative product used by leading companies all over the world to create innovations that can have a positive impact valued and cared for in a people-first company where you will have the recognition you deserve and can be at your best
We still like to meet and work in person, but we are a remote-first team
Be in an environment where you have a voice and can make a difference
Work on innovation management will help you learn what it takes to become an Entrepreneur
Regular two-way feedback to accelerate your career growth and help us to improve
Potential Stock Options in a healthy, growing and promising SaaS business
No micro-management, you will have great amounts of autonomy
Competitive remuneration package
Health insurance
No bureaucracy

How do you know if you want to work at InnovationCast?

You seek to learn and want to grow personally and professionally. The real magic of innovation happens when committed people work smarter to turn ideas into new value. If we don’t become better at what we do, we won’t help our customers do the same. So if you value repetition more than discovery, this job is not for you.

You want to do work that matters for people who care. We’re a startup working to solve a big and relevant problem - one that won’t go away. Helping our customers to get better results through innovation management is - and will ever be - a work in progress. But it is so important and makes a difference for so many people, that the mission inspires you.

You welcome change and actually like to drive it. We strive to give our customers the best tools so they can keep making progress with innovation. This means that we have to experiment a lot with new ideas. As expected, some of them will work, others won’t. You need to be willing to be wrong, not afraid to make mistakes and actively learn from the process.

You don’t want to be micromanaged and want to bring actionable ideas to the team. Innovation is a team sport. Sometimes your work will seem tricky and confusing because you will be working on something that doesn’t exist yet. You will reflect on and understand our thinking and be humble to ask for help, and share difficulties and potential ways forward. But you don’t expect to be given a checklist. When you feel others may be wrong, you speak up and explain your point of view. You value honest communication.

You believe innovation and entrepreneurship can help companies change the way they work and how business is done. You may even want to become an entrepreneur. We’re set to use innovation management and entrepreneurship practices to provide software that helps companies think and act differently at scale. By opening innovation to employees, customers and partners, organizations can explore unforeseen possibilities and make real progress they couldn’t do on their own.

About InnovationCast

We’re a rapidly growing startup with an excellent SaaS product used by top brands globally. And we are on a mission to change the way organizations innovate: for better and for good. Want to join us?

InnovationCast is the collaborative innovation management software (SaaS) that helps organizations discover, incubate, and accelerate ideas. In short, we connect people and ideas and enable them to bring the best ideas to life and make a difference.

We have fantastic customers like DHL, Mayo Clinic, or Delta. We’re backed by Indico Capital, Shilling Capital and accelerated by Google for Startups.

We make innovation simpler, faster, more productive, and even fun. We believe that innovation and entrepreneurship mindsets and practices will become part of how people work daily. And we are set to make it possible and accessible for companies of all shapes and sizes.

Would you like to join a growing team and have an impact on the development of a world-class product? Do you want to work on a software used by thousands of people from top brands worldwide, which is used to innovate on new products, business models, and even social challenges? Then this job may be for you!

Test&Quality engineer

Lokalita: Praha, Česká republika

Název pozice: Test&Quality engineer

Hledáme testera (test & quality engineer) pro tým zabývající se webovými projekty. Úkoly pozice budou: definice testovacích strategií a stanovení rozsahu práce na konkrétních projektech, tvorba testovacích plánů a případů, tvorba podrobných bug a issue reportů, realizace různých typů testů - build/integration/regression ad., tvorba frameworku pro automatizované testování, navrhování opatření ke zlepšování quality assurance při vývoji SW ad.

Požadujeme:

VŠ vzdělání (Bc.) v oboru informatika nebo podobném, praxi minimálně 2 roky v SW společnosti a v testování SW, výborné komunikační schopnosti, schopnost analýzy se smyslem pro detail, schopnost pracovat v distribuovaném týmu, dobrou úroveň písemné i ústní angličtiny, ochotu dále se vzdělávat.

Uvítáme zkušenosti se SW usability, zejména ve webových a mobilních prostředích, zkušenosti s Microsoft Test Manager with Lab Environment a s automatizovanými testy.

Nabízíme:

Zázemí a podporu úspěšné a rostoucí společnosti se sídlem v The Greenline (Kačerov), práci na mezinárodních projektech pro prestižní značky v ČR a EU, HPP na dobu neurčitou, odpovídající finanční podmínky, prostor pro trvalý osobní, odborný i kariérní rozvoj, řadu firemních benefitů (stravenky, příspěvek na penzijní připojištění, týden dovolené navíc, flexibilní pracovní doba, home office...). Nástup možný ihned nebo podle dohody.

The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.

The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That’s where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world’s most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.

Software Engineers in the data platform and clustering teams strike a balance between forward-looking software engineering best practices, and data engineering infrastructure know-how. This team partners with data scientists, research and product teams, helping architect, create and maintain data pipelines. Software Engineers in the data platform and Clustering teams have a deep understanding of blockchain data, are experts at understanding protocol schemas and nuances, build scalable AWS ingest pipelines, lambdas and services. We measure success by the coverage of data clustered for the various Chainalysis products.

In one year you’ll know you were successful if…

Built scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for clustering
Created tools to apply different attributes and heuristics to clustering
Worked with our product teams to ensure accurate data is provided to our customers
Increased coverage of clustering
Contributed to the effectiveness and velocity of team deliverables
You have learned new technologies and shown that you are not afraid to work outside your comfort zone

A Background Like This Helps

Solid understanding of building data pipelines, lakes and streaming services
Some work experience with AWS tools such as S3, Lambdas, and CDKs
Experience with running batch and streaming based ETL/ELT pipelines in production
Understanding of efficient data structures, algorithms and computational complexity
Planned, built, and owned production systems
Experience with Python, Java, and/or Typescript
The versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job
The ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
Bias for action

The Following Would Differentiate You

Experience with cloud environments (AWS, GCP, etc)
Knowledge of blockchain technologies and protocols

At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.

You belong here.

At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Harvey Milk Day, World Humanitarian Day, and UN International Migrants Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.

We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.

Applying from the EU? Please review our Chainalysis Applicant Privacy Policy.

By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.

LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a leading customer engagement company, creating digital experiences powered by Curiously Human AI. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.

You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself.

Overview

We are part of the Unified Messaging Service (UMS) team. UMS is the main backend messaging platform for LivePerson. It manages asynchronous messaging, but is also involved with auto-messaging, shift schedule management, file upload URL requests, and more. As part of this team, we support three application named Controller Bot, Media Handler, and a messaging SDK. Controller bots handle automated messaging for UMS clients. These bots are programmed and directly managed by the clients themselves, but the ownership related to ensuring their functionality is encapsulated here. Media Handler uploads and downloads of files via UMS. And Messaging SDK is a Node.js pass-through layer for internal and external developers to call UMS APIs.

You Will
Produce and inspire high-quality, well-tested code that is easy to read and maintain. Use technical knowledge to build new features, maintain the platform's stability at LivePerson's scale
Use the latest technologies for our customers on a massive scale
Focus on production readiness including root cause analysis, testing, monitoring, and documentation
Contribute to the team's on-call rotation to improve incident coverage
Work with 1-2 teams and work on important functionalities
Design small to mid-level applications and coordinate with other engineers on the team to build scalable solutions
Attend scrum ceremonies such as sprint grooming, sprint planning, and retrospective, and showcase technical solutions to the team
You Have
Must have at least 1 years of experience on Node.JS
Experience or working knowledge with Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Java, AWS and JavaScript
Benefits
Health: medical, dental, and vision
Time away: 28 vacation days
Development: Native AI learning
Additional: Food Vouchers, monthly phone and internet allowance.
Why You'll Love Working Here

Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces.

Belonging At LivePerson

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

job_title: Dutch Language Data Analyst in Barcelona
description:
TELUS International is looking for Language Data Analysts in Barcelona, Spain to work onsite for a machine learning project! At the moment, we are looking for candidates with fluency in Dutch. We offer relocation assistance!

Language Data Analysts will analyze data in a given language and identify potential issues. They will also collaborate with international testing teams and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features. Data obtained will be used to train and improve speech recognition and AI systems.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
Includes, but is not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Linguistic data labeling
Analyzing language data in the given language and identifying potential issues and patterns.
Collaborating with an international testing team and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features.
Communicating with various departments.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Fluency in Dutch.
Preferred educational background: linguistics, literature, or translation.
Available to work onsite in Barcelona, Spain.
Excellent reading, writing, and comprehension skills in English; ability to understand and closely follow elaborate guidelines in English.
In-depth knowledge of native culture and history, staying up to date with day-to-day news and happenings in the target country, and regular use of the language required.
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet project targets.
Self-motivated and able to work as part of a team or independently.
Good computer and software skills across different operating systems.
Strong typing skills.
Good organizational skills.
Adaptable to changing environments.

WHAT WE OFFER:
Attractive salary
Permanent, full-time contract with TELUS International
Private medical insurance for employees and relatives
Great office at a top location
Positive international working environment (relaxing zones, terrace, kitchen)
Discounts in gym memberships
Career development opportunities
No overtime or weekend work
Continuous support and learning
Access to counseling sessions

If this opportunity sounds appealing to you, apply now!
*Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

ABOUT US:

AI Data Solutions

Creating and enhancing the world's data to enable better AI via human intelligence

We help companies test and improve machine learning models via our global AI Community of 1 million+ annotator and linguists. Our proprietary Ground Truth AI training platform handles all data types across 500+ languages and dialects. Our AI Data Solutions vastly enhance AI systems across a range of applications from advanced smart products, to better search results, to expanded speech recognition, to more human-like bot interactions and so much more.

TELUS International values people's diversity and grants equal opportunity regardless of age, civil status, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion and political beliefs, sex, or sexual orientation.

Vivira. Simply move.
The first app on prescription for back pain.

Vivira develops digital health applications (DiGA) for patients with musculoskeletal disorders to reduce pain and restore physical function.

Vivira is a CE-marked medical device and was the first digital health app in Germany for musculoskeletal conditions to be listed in the DiGA directory of the German Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices (BfArM). Since the BfArM listing, all doctors can prescribe Vivira, and all statutory health insurers and increasingly also private health insurers cover the costs.

Vivira helps doctors and patients to close gaps in care where conventional therapies reach their limits: we provide access to therapeutic training independent of time and place, patient-centred and personalised, unlimited by conventional remedy budgets.

In our work, we place the highest value on medical effectiveness, patient safety, data protection and information security. Our fast-growing team, headquartered in Berlin, works entrepreneurially, purposefully, quickly and with an absolute focus on quality.

Data Analyst (m/f/d) (Full-time)
As a Data Analyst at Vivira, you will be vital in helping the company get more transparency on specific business activities and make important operational and tactical. As you tackle complex business questions and innovate in response to medical data-related concerns, you will become a real “flagship” in a rapidly developing and rewarding industry.

Your tasks with us
You have responsibility for visualising requirements from various stakeholders in our Business Intelligence tool
You optimise, maintain and enhance our existing dashboards
You will work closely with our data engineer for gathering more data from existing and future data points
You are a contributor to the enhancement and optimisation of the data gathering and storing, including improving the data quality and efficiency

What you should bring
You have significant experience working as a Data Analyst
You offer strong SQL skills and hands-on experience with tools for data visualisation
An analytical and entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
Experience in data modelling and data visualisation
Analytical mindset, ability to interpret and translate data into actionable insights
You are a problem solver who is able to think independently, go beyond the requirements and suggest new developments
Very good communication skills in English (spoken & written)
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment

What to expect
A meaningful topic with the unique opportunity to make a difference in a completely new area of digital healthcare
A growing company with challenging goals
The flexibility in the arrangement of your working place (office or remote in Germany)
30 days of annual leave
The possibility to work in another EU country for up to 1 month
You will be welcomed by highly motivated and friendly colleagues in a dynamic, transparent and open corporate culture

Job Description:

The role in a Nutshell:

The Implementation Consultant (IC) position role is to gather the data needed to set up the payroll project in the FR payroll engine, perform this set up and associated reports alone or with the help of a payroll provider software engineer, manage the project in its early days from the data gathering phase, till first month of Go live, having managed and produced in between the monthly parallel runs needed to have a perfect setup and produce the monthly payroll.

The IC is responsible for the project management till the Go live if the project is managed only at local market (LM) level or follows the guidance and phasing (and then use Safeguard (SG) templates) of the Global Implementation team.

How you will make a difference:

Support FR GM if needed in RFP calls in explaining FR Paryoll specifics and how Implementation is taking place from a FR payroll engine and process perspective
Support Global Managed Payroll (GMP)/Implementation team on calls with clients to complete the FR payroll specifics explanations and templates adaptations if needed
Complete the FR LM part of the SG global implementation team documents to align Unity (SG GMP software) – FR payroll engine and client input.
Based on the different set of data contained in Gross to Net (GTN), previous DSN, master data files, CRM, and all HR/CBA/client specific agreement, create in the payroll engine:
Continue to support GMP Implementation team, with any adjustments on the mapping.
Prepare Go live and manage all interactions, additional requests or set up at LM level
Prepare the transition to Production/Operations by creating the client profile template and organise with Payroll Team leader the client account creation in Global Unity (GU)

What would give an advantage:

Bachelor’s degree. Degree in business related field would be an advantage.
Full knowledge about FR payroll and FR HR related legislation
Full knowledge about current FR Payroll engine set up
Minimum level of Cambridge level C1 in English and French, written and oral communication skills are essential.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, Mainly Xls, but Word also
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, along with strong interpersonal skills. Must have the ability to comfortably interact & communicate with all levels of the organization.
A self-starter personality with ability to adapt to shifting priorities and meet deadlines in a changing environment.

Why become a Guardian:

We are committed to building a company that empowers individuals from diverse backgrounds and values diversity of thought as a beacon for performance

️ International Environment: Our teams are borderless. Interact, collaborate, discover cultures, and expand your personal network beyond your country.
🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Our Culture : We are nurturing a workplace where everything you do is in harmony with who you are. Where your ideas will always find their way to our leaders, and your contribution recognized.
Autonomy & Flexibility (Work in Any Way): As a fellow Guardian, you will decide when, how and where you work best. We value results, not working hours.
Learning: Even though perfection is impossible to reach, we support everyone striving towards it by providing you access to 2 learning platforms. Learn at your own pace, as much and whatever you need.
✨Valuable Experience: Wherever you go, challenges will await you. At Safeguard Global you will find the “right” challenges to hone you into the ultimate professional.

We believe our love of laughter makes us a better company. Here at Safeguard Global, we sincerely care about each other, about our families, and about our clients, and that's what makes us different.

At Safeguard Global, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and Guardians.

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

About the opportunity:

Frontiers catalog is growing. Every month we need to handle more journals, articles, and research topics, to process more data and enable new features for our users.

We are looking for a Data Scientist (Graph) Team Lead with experience leading teams, to join our business and manage a Data Team formed by Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

You will define, plan and coordinate internal technical projects related to our Data Products. The development and evolution of knowledge graphs, and the creation of a solid data foundation to empower our data scientists and our machine learning team.

Key Responsibilities
Lead, coach and evolve your team, creating a culture of excellence that will allow them professional growth.
Plan and coordinate the activities for the creation of data products and features that extract value from data in our different systems.
Lead the work in a complex data-intensive environment, handle the integration with systems built by other teams.
Map business and technical requirements into actionable initiatives, reporting and analyzing results in a timely manner, and learning from any mistakes
Work close to the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning team, to help them to extract the maximum value and empower their initiatives.
Collaborate with other leaders to identify and capitalize on opportunities to leverage new technologies and create novel solutions to our organizations challenges.

What we are looking for:
Minimum 5 years experience as a Senior Data Scientist or Senior Data Engineer with at least 3 years leading teams
A natural leader, proactive and hands-on
Comfortable handling uncertainty in evolving scenarios who can understand priorities and balance them
Strong knowledge of current industry-wide Data Engineering and DS/ML practices, tools, and techniques
Our technical stack is based on GCP, Google BigQuery, Kafka, Databricks, PySpark, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch and therefore knowledge on any of these would be highly beneficial
These are some of the data challenges we are working on and therefore any experience with these would be beneficial:
Knowledge of Neo4j
Knowledge of Cypher queries
Experience working with knowledge graph
Familiarity with Agile framework
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing
Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

job_title: Iternship Data Analyst (Data Science for Online Marketing) (m/f/x)
description:
You enjoy analyzing data and easily recognize correlations? You are passionate about visualizing numbers and discovering insights? Then apply now for a 3 to 12 months internship as a data analyst and learn from and with our consulting team.

Tasks
You plan, implement, and optimize data projects in the area of digital marketing.
You create and maintain reports and dashboards.
You carry out ad-hoc data analyses.
You derive insights and recommendations based on the collected data.
You ensure high data quality.
You communicate directly with clients on data-based digital marketing projects.

Requirements
You are studying (business) computer science, mathematics, statistics or digital marketing and have an experienced approach to data analysis.
You have basic know-how in the area of databases (SQL, Postgres) and have already gained experience in the area of business intelligence and data visualization (including Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio).
First experience in performance marketing and programming skills (Python) are an advantage.
Fluency in English
Fluency in German is an advantage

Benefits
Remote or VI office: you decide if you want to work from home, the VI office or a mix of both.
Cross-location trainings: take part in our wide range of VI Academy trainings to evolve and grow aside from our daily business and connect with others.
Flexible working hours: use our flexible working hours.
Team events: you and your team members each get 200 € per year for team activities.
Unpaid vacation days: additionally to your vacation days, you can take up to 10 unpaid days.

At Virtual Identity we are passionate about tackling day-to-day problems, solving them digitally and coming up with solutions that are not only fun but – most importantly – useful. For people as well as brands. We have done so for the past 25 years and are currently counting 160 colleagues across three countries (Germany, Austria, Portugal). We are always looking for new talents, willing to push digital boundaries as well as their own – through exciting projects, trainings and of course working within a team of motivated colleagues.

For a compulsory internship for your university degree, you will receive a remuneration (depending on scope and duration). For a voluntary internship, your monthly gross salary (full time) is € 1,758.50

Interested? Then send in your application! We look forward to meeting you!

We are looking for Data Engineers to work on a major international project.

100% remote work.

Offer addressed to workers from any EEC country.

Tasks

Working language:English
Develops and constructs data products and services and integrates them into systems and business processes.
Implements data flows to connect operational systems, data for analytics and product development and business intelligence (BI) systems
Automates manual data flows to enable scaling and repeatable use.
Transforms data into a useful format for analysis, through optimized ETL jobs and streaming processing.
Builds accessible data for analysis and data products development.
Has familiarity with the privacy regulation and is an ambassador of privacy by design.

Mastery with Python and/or Scala
Mastery with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop,

Spark, PySprak
Proficiency in Machine Learning LifeCycle, CI/CD,

MLOps
Experience with public Cloud solutions

(GCP&|AWS)

provision management tool (sutch as Saltstack, Terraform or Puppet)
Proficiency with modern monitoring solutions in

cloud environments (grafana, alertmanager, pometheus, Datadog) - Experience in deploying,

optimizing and maintaining Airflow, Kafka, Cassandra or Flink

Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions
What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge
Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming

Job Description

Dołącz do Natek Poland i stań się członkiem zespołu dedykowanego cenionej na rynku instytucji z sektora bankowego. Jeśli jesteś otwarty/a na nowe doświadczenia, aplikuj do nas! Czeka na Ciebie m.in. greenfieldowy projekt rozwoju systemu do zarządzania danymi Klienta oraz realizacja zadań z obszaru analizy jakości danych.

Your responsibilities

Przygotowywanie i aktualizacja metryk jakości danych oraz ich implementacja w ramach procesu monitorowania jakości danych
Profilowanie dużych zbiorów danych
Praca nad poprawą danych lub ich jakości, wdrażanie nowych rozwiązań
Współpraca z biznesowym Klientem wewnętrznym
Wypracowywanie procesów zarządzania jakością danych

Our requirements

2+ lat doświadczenia (preferowane: w obszarach zarządzania informacją lub jakością danych)
Doświadczenie w operacyjnej pracy z danymi
Bardzo dobra znajomość SQL
Dobra znajomość baz danych
Doświadczenie w branży z rynku regulowanego

Mile widziane:

Doświadczenie w bankowości / finansach
Doświadczenie z AB Initio

Benefits

Długofalowa współpraca oparta o nasze wartości: edukacja, partnerstwo i odpowiedzialność,
Praca w projektach dedykowanych dla największych marek na świecie z sektora finansowego i telekomunikacyjnego,
Możliwość wymiany doświadczeń w międzynarodowych środowisku i rozwoju w projektach realizowanych w Polsce, lub innych krajach: Słowacja, Czechy, Bułgaria,
Praca w nowoczesnym środowisku z innowacyjnymi technologiami,
Elastyczne godziny pracy,
Możliwość pracy 100% zdalnej (),
Prywatna opieka medyczna,
Karta Multisport lub My Cafeteria,
Ubezpieczenie na życie,
NATEK loyalty Club,
Możliwość dołączenia do społeczności odpowiedzialnej społecznie i uczestniczenia w inicjatywach firmowych,
Dla kontraktorów - uprawnienie do 23 dodatkowych dni świadczenia usług w roku.

We are a digitally native technology services company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use some of the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field to empower organizations in every aspect.

Right now, we are looking for Golang Developers to join our team at Globant!

You Will Get The Chance To
Work with professionals who have created some of the most revolutionary solutions in their fields.
Make an impact. Work in large-scale projects globally.
Develop your career in our Studios. Each Studio represents deep pockets of expertise on the latest technologies and trends and delivers tailored solutions focused on specific challenges.
Develop your career within an industry or multiple industries.
Work in the city you want, and be nourished by cultural exchanges.
Be empowered to choose your career path: we have more than 600 simultaneous projects, so you can choose where and how to work.
Be part of an agile pod. Driven by a culture of self-regulated teamwork, each team -or POD- works directly with our customers with a full maturity path that evolves as they increase speed, quality and autonomy.

What Will Help You Succeed
Believe and love what you do.
Build bridges & open doors.
Enjoy solving problems.
Being capable of taking a step back to look at a bigger picture.
Intermediate English skills.
Good understanding of Golang, especially concurrency, unit testing. Having experience with libraries like gorm, go kit, testify, etc., will be welcome!
Besides Golang, it is very important to have a good background on backend technologies in general, such as are microservices, cloud computing (AWS, GCP, Azure, others), REST, gRPC and Protobuf, Docker, CI/CD, Kubernetes, message brokers, monitoring tools, among others.
Good knowledge on different database engines both, SQL and NoSQL
Keep scalability in mind, always.

At Globant we believe that an inclusive culture and a diverse environment makes us stronger. We encourage people to have an inclusive spirit as our global footprint expands. We seek to generate a place of inspiration and growth for everyone. A safe space, based on equity as a value, where everyone's careers can be promoted and developed in the same way. There is no innovation without diversity and there is no improvement without plurality.

This job be filled from Anywhere in Ecuador.

Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Service Delivery department in advanced data analysis and reporting. You will participate in projects that partner with multiple areas of the business, as well as help with goal setting and KPIs. Your strong analytical and reporting skills will allow you to report on Service Delivery metrics and make meaningful recommendations that advance the priorities and efficiency of the team. You’ll work closely with Service Delivery leaders on target setting, capacity planning, customer experience reporting, performance reporting and other data analysis projects.

Role Responsibilities

Accountable in being the subject matter expert as it pertains to data governance for Service Delivery.
Create moderate to complex reporting solutions (Tableau, SalesForce) based on existing datasets
Run, interpret and share data and performance results with stakeholders, including standardized reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis from various inputs (Salesforce, JIRA, telephony solution, etc.) using various outputs (Excel, PPT, Tableau).
Surface insights and contribute to planning through accurate reporting and data analysis for our Service Delivery teams.
Assist in the discovery work needed for Service Delivery Operations programs, including but not limited to, data collection, scrubbing and presenting.
Report on departmental and team goals, maintain dashboards, and provide data analysis to your leader to make strong recommendations that meaningfully contribute to Relativity’s Service Delivery strategy.
Adhere to best practices in reporting and data quality that allow the Service Delivery team to accurately report on key activities.
Participate in business-critical operational projects that partner, collaborate, and strategize with teams inside and outside of Service Delivery.
Run ad hoc projects as needed that are data driven, focusing on success metrics specific to teams.

Minimum Qualifications

Experience with a SaaS or subscription-based software company.
Intermediate knowledge of a CRM tool, preferably Salesforce.com
Exceptional skills in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on Excel
1+ years experience building or enhancing dashboards within data visualization tools (eg. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik)
Familiarity with SQL and relational databases
Familiarity with statistical analysis / data mining techniques and software
Ability to analyze and document complex business processes.

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Benefit Highlights

Comprehensive health plans

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Equity program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

About Us

We are a SaaS company born in Florence, Italy in 2016 with the mission of simplifying the way people ship, track and return their e-commerce orders by creating a technological layer capable of handling the complexity of Shipping & Logistics.

We are an international scale-up where people from different countries, cultures and languages work together every day to deliver innovation.

This is reflected in every product we build but also in the attention and care for the people that are working in our company.

We are currently scaling our business leveraging our technology, our team and our international culture. We are 80+ people in Europe and we have recently raised Series A funding from US investors, fueling our objectives. It is now time to grow even more and increase our talented tech team with engineers that want to contribute to the development of our products.

Who Are We Looking For

The role of the data analyst is to analyze data sets to find ways to solve problems relating to a business's customers. The expectation is that you have the knowledge and skills to turn raw data into information and insight, which can be used to make business decisions.

ShippyPro has developed the largest logistic e-commerce library online and we are looking for someone passionate about data and the insights that you can generate from it. Every hour thousands of shipments are generated on our platform and as a Data Analyst, you will be responsible to make sense of the amount of data that we collect. In this role, you will be working on internal data, for helping us drive the success of the business, as well as, building insights for our customers

What you will do:

Building and owning internal business intelligence dashboards that we use for making strategic decisions every day
Generating information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns
Analysing data to find answers to specific questions
Preparing reports for executive and project teams
Creating visualizations of data

What you will bring to the table:

You have 3+ years of documented experience in Data Analyst
Strong mathematical & numeracy skills
Strong understanding of databases of SQL Server
Good knowledge of AWS RedShift
Understanding of reporting & data visualization tools like Metabase
Understanding of ETL framework and ETL tools
Excellent analytical skills - the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data
Excellent problem-solving skills and strong attention to detail
Presentation skills – ability to write and speak clearly to easily communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand
Communication skills with effective stakeholder management & conflict resolution skills

About the hiring process:

We don’t just interview candidates, we interview people.

After we receive your application, we start the screening process and if you successfully pass through this step, we will invite you to take part in some interviews.

Usually, the first one is with our Talent Acquisition Specialist to get to know each other. The following steps are more technical and they can include a business challenge.

Don't worry, we will share with you all the information you need to succeed!

What we can offer:

Our technical stack includes SQL, RedShift, and Metabase.

Remote working options. We are happy to welcome every new member into our state-of-the-art (literally!) office in Florence, however, we are also a modern and agile company, and are open to full or partial remote working where possible

No clocking in/out. We don’t believe in micromanaging and our working relationships are based on mutual trust, that’s why we don’t require our team to clock in and out of work. Of course, this trust relationship works both ways!

Work alongside an ambitious and supportive team. We are growing fast and no two days look the same at ShippyPro, but one thing never changes: your colleagues are always there to support you and to bounce off ideas!

Growth and learning opportunities. We believe that in order to grow as a company, our team also needs to continue learning and developing. Did you know that we have a growing Library in our office and you can borrow as many books as you like?

Meal pearks*: Whether you are working from home, from the office or from wherever you want, you can enjoy your meal voucher everyday. Getting hungry?

Free coffee policy. We are an international team, but our HQ is in Italy, hence we do take coffee breaks very seriously. Hot drinks are on us, and occasionally, Aperitivo too!

No dress code. That’s right, no formal attire is required when working in our HQ

only for Italian contract

We are a people-centric organization with one mission: “Make People Work Better”.

Are you determined to beat off the challenges this role brings? Send your application to join us.

French Version Below***

We are hiring our new Data Engineer to join our DHT team in our Lyon (France) or Harwell (UK) offices.


Let's talk about the role:


As part of a data-driven organization, the primary role of the Data Engineer is to unlock the full potential of our data by development/Operations and maintenance of the data platform & ultimately putting data at the fingertips of various stakeholders in the world. You will share in the ownership of our data platform, from ingress through transformation and access/integration.

Let’s talk about responsibilities:

Work with the US and APAC teams and make sure that the EU data platform follows the same standards and the same architecture.
Help other teams in APAC and US to investigate data platform and data pipeline related issues.
Work with various teams to define & document data platform architecture across integrated Enterprise Systems
Assemble large, complex data that meet functional/non-functional business requirements
Use the infrastructure/services required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS services.
Support & maintain data pipeline integrations and solutions, incorporating highly scalable cloud computing and large-scale data stores including data lakes, data warehouses, and data marts
Bring the best-practice experience to proactively and continuously build data-related practices within the team
Contribute to the scalability of both data infrastructure and team processes, standards, and workflow
Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data requirement needs.
Perform Snowflake database administration tasks, AWS admin tasks and related technology admin tasks.

Let’s talk about qualifications and experience:


Required:

Minimum of 5 years of experience working on Enterprise Systems
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
Experience in developing scalable ETLs and data processes
Good experience in Oracle EBS/ERP databases and/or Oracle cloud and/or Oracle Fusion
Good understanding of shell scripts
Experience with AWS cloud services, including S3, EC2, Lambda, IAM etc.

Preferred:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Biology, Computer Science, or other relevant fields
Minimum of 10 years of related experience
Proficiency in Snowflake
Exposure to Terraform, Airflow and SOS-Berlin Job Scheduler (JS7)
Exposure to Kafka, DBT
Experience administering any database and database security. Snowflake or Oracle or Teradata is preferred

Additional information:

At Resmed, all employees benefit from a bonus plan, the percentage of which depends on your position within the organisation.
Working from home flexibility
You also have access to a referral bonus and to ResMed's preferred shareholding programme
Competitive benefits (Pension, Long-Term Illness Protection, Health Insurance...)
Internal career opportunity - joining an international fast-pace and massively growing company

Ok, so what's next?


Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

Nous recrutons notre futur(e) Data Engineer H/F pour rejoindre notre équipe DHT sur notre site de Saint-Priest.


Parlons du poste :


Dans le cadre d'une organisation axée sur les données, le rôle principal du Data Engineer est de libérer le plein potentiel de nos données par le développement et la maintenance de la plate-forme de données et de mettre les données à la portée de diverses parties prenantes dans le monde. Vous partagerez la responsabilité de notre plate-forme de données, de l'entrée à la transformation et à l'accès/l'intégration.

Parlons des responsabilités :

Travailler avec les équipes des États-Unis et de l'APAC et s'assurer que la plate-forme de données de l'UE suit les mêmes normes et la même architecture.
Aider d'autres équipes de l'APAC et des États-Unis à enquêter sur les problèmes liés à la plate-forme de données et au pipeline de données.
Travailler avec diverses équipes pour définir et documenter l'architecture de la plate-forme de données dans les systèmes d'entreprise intégrés
Assembler des données volumineuses et complexes qui répondent aux exigences fonctionnelles/non fonctionnelles de l'entreprise
Utilisez l'infrastructure/les services requis pour optimiser l'extraction, la transformation et le chargement des données à partir d'une grande variété de sources de données à l'aide des services SQL et AWS.
Soutenir et maintenir les intégrations et les solutions de pipeline de données, en incorporant un cloud computing hautement évolutif et des magasins de données à grande échelle, y compris des lacs de données, des entrepôts de données et des magasins de données
Apporter l'expérience des meilleures pratiques pour développer de manière proactive et continue des pratiques liées aux données au sein de l'équipe
Contribuer à l'évolutivité de l'infrastructure de données et des processus, normes et flux de travail de l'équipe
Travailler avec les parties prenantes pour résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux données et répondre à leurs besoins en matière de données.
Effectuez des tâches d'administration de base de données Snowflake, des tâches d'administration AWS et des tâches d'administration de technologie associées.

Parlons des qualifications et de l'expérience :


Obligatoire:

Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience de travail sur des systèmes d'entreprise
Maîtrise de l'anglais indispensable
Connaissance avancée de SQL et expérience de travail avec des bases de données relationnelles
Expérience dans le développement d'ETL et de processus de données évolutifs
Bonne expérience des bases de données Oracle EBS/ERP et/ou Oracle cloud et/ou Oracle Fusion
Bonne compréhension des scripts shell
Expérience avec les services cloud AWS, y compris S3, EC2, Lambda, IAM etc.

Souhaitées :

Diplôme en mathématiques, économie, statistiques, biologie, informatique ou autres domaines pertinents
Minimum de 10 ans d'expérience connexe
Exposition à Terraform, Airflow et SOS-Berlin Job Scheduler (JS7)
Maîtrise de Snowflake
Exposition à Kafka, DBT
Expérience de l'administration de toute base de données et de la sécurité des bases de données. Snowflake ou Oracle ou Teradata est préférable

Autres avantages et informations :

Proche des transports en commun – Arrêt T2 Parc Technologique de Saint Priest
Chez Resmed, tous les employés bénéficient d’un plan de bonus dont le pourcentage dépend de votre emploi au sein de l’organisation.
Vous bénéficierez aussi de l’intéressement et de la participation aux conditions fixées par nos accords internes.
Vous avez également accès à une prime de cooptation et au programme d’actionnariat privilégié de ResMed.
Enfin, tickets restaurants, salle de repas sur place, mutuelle, remboursement de la moitié des transports en commun et activités du CE font également parti de vos avantages.

OK, quelle est la prochaine étape?


Rejoindre ResMed, signifie bien plus que dire "oui" à l'idée de faire du monde un endroit plus sain. C'est découvrir une carrière pleine de défis, de soutien et d'inspiration. Une culture axée sur l'excellence qui vous aide non seulement à atteindre vos objectifs, mais aussi à en créer de nouveaux. Nous nous attachons à créer une culture diversifiée et inclusive, à encourager l'expression individuelle sur le lieu de travail et à prospérer grâce aux idées novatrices qui en découlent. Si ce lieu de travail vous convient, postulez dès maintenant !

Umíš používat SAP a pracuješ s daty na denní bázi? Pohybuješ se v oblasti zavádění procesů ve společnosti? Komunikace v angličtině na denní bázi pro tebe není překážkou?

V tom případě jsi přesně náš člověk!

Pro inovativní německou společnost hledáme posilu, která doplní tým datových analytiků v Brně. Zázemí společnosti je v centru Brna, ale pracovat je možné odkudkoliv na full remote.

předchozí praxe z oblasti implementace procesů ve společnosti (výroba, logistika, provoz, finance)

Über uns
In weniger als 9 Jahren hat sich die Legal One vom Startup zum Hidden Champion im Bereich Legal Tech und Legal Advertising entwickelt. Mit über 50 Mitarbeiter*innen aus über 12 Ländern, 10 Mio. Seitenaufrufen pro Monat und mehreren erfolgreichen Softwareprodukten versuchen wir jeden Tag, neue Maßstäbe zu setzen. Unser Ziel ist es, die Durchsetzung von Recht modern, einfach und bezahlbar zu machen.
Wenn du überdurchschnittlich motiviert bist und dich in einem freundlichen, kollegialen Arbeitsumfeld fachlich und persönlich weiterentwickeln willst, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung. Um als Unternehmen weiter zu wachsen, suchen wir einen

Data Analyst (m/w/d) (Remote/ Home Office)

Deine Aufgaben
In Zusammenarbeit mit unserem technischen Team stellst du sicher, dass die Datenstruktur in unserem DWH auf dem neuesten Stand ist und den allgemeinen Anforderungen des Unternehmens entspricht
Du kümmerst dich darum, dass die KPIs auf sinnvolle Weise gemessen werden
Die Stakeholder können bei der Nutzung unseres Reporting-Tools auf deine Hilfe zählen, und du nimmst Anpassungen vor, um deren Bedürfnissen gerecht zu werden
Du verwaltest deine Aufgaben in Jira und dokumentierst deine Arbeit (z.B. wie bestimmte KPIs berechnet werden)
Optional: Du entwickelst ein bestehendes Kategorisierungs- und Vorhersagemodell weiter und arbeitest an alternativen Modellierungen, welche die Qualität der Kategorisierung/Vorhersage verbessern

Dein Profil
Du hast Erfahrungen in der Arbeit mit Tableau gesammelt
Die Verwaltung großer Data Warehouses mit komplexen Datenstrukturen ist für dich kein Problem
Du bist in der Lage, dich in KPI’s einzuarbeiten und sicherzustellen, dass diese zu 100 % korrekt sind. Dabei schreckst du auch nicht davor zurück, Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen außerhalb des DWH zu aggregieren
Mit Datenbankabfragen kennst du dich sehr gut aus
Du kennst den Unterschied zwischen Mittelwert und Median und bekommst auch bei Interferenz statistischen Methoden keinen Schreck
Python-Kenntnisse wären ein Plus, sind aber nicht erforderlich
Bitte beachte: Für diese Position sind fließende Deutschkenntnisse erforderlich. Bitte bewirb dich nur, wenn du diese Voraussetzung erfüllst

Was wir bieten
Einen krisensicheren Job mit spannenden Projekten
Wir sind groß genug, um Schlagkraft zu entwickeln, aber dabei immer noch so agil wie ein Startup. Durch diese Kombination können Ideen innerhalb kürzester Zeit umgesetzt und getestet werden
Du kannst (abgesehen von einer Einarbeitungsphase) zu 80-100% im Home Office arbeiten
Erfahrene und motivierte Kolleg*innen, die jeden Tag gerne zur Arbeit kommen und Lust haben, Dinge zu verändern und voranzutreiben

Spare Geld mit Corporate Benefits bei über 500 teilnehmenden Partnern

Das sind wir

Als einer der zehn Fokuspartner von Microsoft in Deutschland mit zahlreichen Gold-Kompetenzen sowie Microsoft Fast Forward Partner und als Mitglied im Partner Advisory Council, setzen wir ein starkes Zeichen als Vorreiter in der IT-Branche. Gemeinsam mit unseren 140 Mitarbeitenden generieren wir relevante IT-Lösungen mit Bestand und exzellenter Qualität für unsere Kunden im Mittelstand. Wir verzichten auf schnörkelreiche Lösungspakete und stehen für Transparenz, Zuverlässigkeit und Tatendrang.

Was dich erwartet

Fortschritt statt Stillstand - Bei uns kannst du auf die bestmögliche Unterstützung deiner Führungskräfte und Teamkollegen bauen. Es erwartet dich ein freundliches und lockeres Miteinander auf Augenhöhe. Unsere Duz-Kultur fängt schon beim gemeinsamen Kennenlernen an und hört auch im Austausch mit der Geschäftsführung nicht auf.

Wir schaffen zusammen mit unseren Mitarbeitenden ein angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten möglich ist. Wir glauben: Zufriedenheit entsteht, wenn sich Beruf und Privatleben gut miteinander vereinbaren lassen. Ob Remote-Tätigkeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten oder Vertrauensarbeitszeit - wir schaffen gemeinsam eine Arbeitswelt, die passt.

Das macht diesen Job aus

Deine Expertise bei der Modernisierung der Rechenzentren im deutschen Mittelstand ist gefragt!

Du unterstützt unsere Kunden beim schrittweisen Umzug in die Microsoft Azure-Cloud, erstellst die dazugehörigen Konzepte und setzt diese um.

Dabei bist du der Spezialist im Bereich Microsoft und Open Source Datenbanksysteme und bist für die korrekte Implementierung der Zielsysteme sowie die Migration der vorhandenen Datenbanken verantwortlich.

Darüber hinaus erstellst und hältst du individuelle Kundenschulungen, Workshops sowie Präsentationen.

Was dich auszeichnet
Du verfügst über mehrjährige praktische Erfahrungen mit der Installation, Konfiguration und dem Betrieb von Datenbanksystemen und hast erfolgreich eigenständig Kundenprojekte in diesem Bereich durchgeführt.
Du bist fit, wenn es um die Administration und das Performance-Tuning von Microsoft SQL-Server und Open Source Datenbanken wie PostgreSQL, MySQL und MongoDB geht.
Du begeisterst dich für Datenbanktechnologien in Microsoft Azure und jonglierst sicher mit Migrationskonzepten wie Rehosting und Refactoring.
Du berätst unsere Kunden stets auf "der Höhe der Zeit" und behältst technologische Trends und Entwicklungen im Auge.
Du bist ein echter Teamplayer. Wenn du Herausforderungen im Team bemerkst, gibst du aktiv Feedback und kümmerst dich um eine Lösungsfindung.
Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann bewerbe dich gleich online und werde Teil von abtis. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Diese Position bieten wir sowohl als reinen Homeoffice-Arbeitsplatz an wie auch an einem unserer Standorte (Berlin, Freiburg im Breisgau, Stuttgart, Pforzheim oder Göppingen).

Benefits

Weiterentwicklung

Mentorenprogramme, persönliches Fortbildungsbudget oder Zertifizierungen – wir unterstützen dich bestmöglich bei deiner Entwicklung. Unser Wir-Gefühl

Hilfsbereit, immer wissbegierig, begeistert von Technologie und echte Teamplayer. Teamspirit wird bei uns groß geschrieben! Modernes Arbeiten

Vertrauensarbeitszeit, Homeoffice, flache Hierarchien, Einsatz von neusten Technologien – wir schaffen gemeinsam eine Arbeitswelt, die passt. Work-Life-Harmony

Kostenübernahme von Kindergartenbeiträgen, 30 Tage Jahresurlaub, Fitnessstudiozuschuss - wir unterstützen dich gern.

The Role

We are seeking an experienced individual to join our Global Technology team as a Database Engineer. In this role, you work with a global engineering team to design, develop, and enhance database and ETL related code. You will support and refine database coding standards, and work with development teams to leverage them in practice. The ideal candidate would have deep technical expertise in ANSI SQL, ETL, and modelling development, possess strong organizational and collaboration skills, feel comfortable working across distributed teams worldwide.

What You’ll Do
Work across a geographically split team to deliver global data solutions.
Manage development standards for database development (SQL and ETL)
Collaborate with other teams in enterprise level projects and provide support / guidance as needed
Develop key components/templates for offshore teams, evangelize and educate them
Support of multiple SQL & NoSQL technologies; mainly Oracle & SQL data solutions
Examine database workloads and performance KPIs to tune and implement enhancements
Build and improve automation for release pipelines
Determine the most effective ways to optimize performance of existing solutions
Create and maintain technical documentation.

What You’ll Bring
Expertise in ANSI SQL programming, particularly with SQL Server and Oracle
Expertise in ETL design and development, SSIS and Informatica are key
Performance tuning experience
Exposure to NoSQL and Graph programming
Strong attention to detail
Champion team success over individual accomplishment
Passionate about learning and continuous improvement
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field required
3+ years of prior technology leadership and development experience
Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to multitasking and quick learning.
Commitment to satisfying internal and external customers
Strong desire to win
Intellectual curiosity, and a can-do attitude

Job Details

What You Will Do

Is Azure your top environment? Are you delivering PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions? Join our international team, and support Azure Data Lake now and Azure Snowflake in the future!

How You Will Do It
Proactive administration & support of Azure Data Lake Platform including admin, incident management & troubleshooting
Be the point of contact for Azure PaaS services including Data Factory, ADLS, Databricks, Synapse & DevOps – Capacity/Cost tracking
Support & Maintain – Big Data Cluster – based on HD Insight, Azure Synapse & Hive
Define standards & best methodologies with Technical Architects & ensure they are implemented or maintained
Liaise with Microsoft Support & SMEs in the escalation & resolution of platform issues
Collaborate with partners of all levels to coordinate, maintain & support Data platforms along with ETL Jobs using Azure Data Factory (ADF)
Design & implement solutions in the Azure cloud platform & related technologies for various enterprise applications
Build solutions to monitor, trace, log & address any concerns in cloud-based data platform architecture
Required

What we look for
3+ years hands-on experience using various methodologies to deliver robust PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions using Azure Cloud technologies
Database technologies i.e. Azure SQL and Azure HD Insight
Overview of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Snowflake, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Security Management with Ranger policies
PowerShell or other scripting languages
Technical troubleshooting, log analysis & performance optimization experience
Preferred
Degree in Software Engineering/Computer Science or similar
The expertise of Azure cloud-based data platform architecture
Expertise in Big data platforms, HIVE & Enterprise data platform
Azure Synapse, ARM Template
Azure DevOps – Repo’s, CI/CD with multiple services integrated
Programming skills using Java, Python, .Net
Excellent stakeholder management, communication & influencing skills
Understanding trends, industry standards & new concepts in Data & Analytics space
Our Benefits

Besides working in an international environment, you will receive a regularly monthly bonus after your first six months, meal vouchers, a recreation allowance and retail discounts. Additionally, our flexible benefits program will allow you to customize benefits from a selection of 3500 products and service such as gym membership, medical cover, a multi-sports card plus many more.

Our onsite facilities at our Bratislava based office includes a fitness center, canteen, nursery and coffee machines located on every floor.

If you are relocating to Bratislava to join Johnson Controls, you will be eligible to receive a housing allowance to help you setup your new life in Slovakia.

The gross monthly salary for this position starts from 2500 EUR per month, plus a monthly bonus that starts after your first 6 months. Please note this is a minimum salary and our compensation packages are based on your professional experience and qualifications.

Our culture

At Johnson Controls you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting projects in today’s market. Our hardworking people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, results-oriented, hardworking and above all fun.

We believe that diversity and inclusion matter and make a difference. By embracing the true value of diversity and inclusion, getting comfortable with having crucial conversations, and valuing different perspectives, we will be one of the most desirable places to work.

#software #engineering #railway

IKOS is the European leading consulting firm specialized in railway engineering. We are committed to participate in the ecological transition and to develop the means of transportation of the future that are safe and durable. With 1300 consultants on our team, supported by our R&D hub IKOS Lab, we provide you the opportunity of an international career in a multicultural environment. The Group currently holds 24 offices in 12 countries (France, Spain, Belgium, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Italy, the UK, the USA, Canada, Morocco and Portugal). Since our creation in 2005, we strive for excellence to meet our clients’ needs in signalling and control systems, rolling stock, low voltage and telecoms, energy and high voltage, as well as infrastructures and tracks.

Your role

To keep on building IKOS’ growth and strengthen our engineering team in Belgium, we are currently looking for software engineers, keen to work on projects in the railway or energy sector. Your responsibilites will include:
Participate in order to the complete development cycle of the embedded software
Design application software for Railway equipment regarding customer requirements
Write the software requirement specification according to the functional requirement specification
Support the validation activities on test bench
Participate in audits within the framework of the software certifications
Manage software development planning in agreement with project planning

Your profile
Master’s Degree in Engineering in the field of electromechanics, electronics, telecommunications, software, infrastructure, mechanics, electricity or construction
Basic knowledge with Integrated Development Environment with CEI 61131 Languages (Control Build, Matlab/Simulink)
Basic knowledge in Control systems
Good English oral & written expression
